author: {'steamid': '76561198081181649', 'num_games_owned': 879, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1542, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1711979225}
review:
Просто конченная игра.Я говорю об обычном режиме.
После босса-паука начинается какой-то ад , где мобы тебя чуть ли не ваншотают.
Игра заставляет яро гриндить и передавать хорошие вещи на повторный забег.
В локации с библиотекой вообще жопень страшная.Мне помогало при смерти ALT + F4.Благо при таком раскладе тебя откидывает на последнее место сохранения.
Работает с 5 и далее этажей только механика Бей и беги.То есть зарядил атаку ,лупанул и отбежал назад и так до победного,я вообще не понимаю как можно тут бить обычными быстрыми ударами и играть на каких -то парированиях,это просто неблагодарная дрочь.
Огромный дизлайк за то ,что играть можно только через усиленные атаки и имбовость мобов на высоких этажах.
Так-то проект неплохой,но вот эта дичь убивает.

P.S. Я люблю сложные игры , но здесь сила мобов не оправдана.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982357224', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1710701693}
review:
I really like the gameplay of this. I really wanted to love it. It's a great concept. The combat is great. The art is nice and different too. And it's a cool throwback to old Dungeon Crawlers. But it really needs a lot of tweaks. But basically the procedural nature of the levels - or actually how bad it is implemented - is the worst part of it. The randomness of the levels creates way too many absolutely unfair and stupid situations that could be avoided with just a bit of better design and just a bit more respect for players' time.

It will not be uncommon for you as a lvl1 or 2, in the two beginning dungeons, to suddenly enter a room that is a trap (and no way to identify it as such), that blocks all exits as soon as you touch a pixel inside, and throws immediately two zombies at you, and an enemy on the other side of said room that shoots projectiles at you. And you only have a knife and some pants.. and you can't move because the zombies were right at the entrance and jumped at you as soon as you got in, and again the door behind you is now blocked, so you are stuck and can't move at all.. and the projectiles from the enemy on the back of the room pass through the zombies, so you can't reach him or dodge those attacks as well.

So you'll die and die and die in the beginning dungeons. Not because its your fault, but because the game is just incredibly bad and poorly designed at the first two dungeons. If you managed to be lucky or very persistent, or both, and you manage to get the good items then there is fun to be had after the the second dungeon (and sometimes it gets too easy afterwards ironically). But to get there you'll suffer a lot from repetition, since your skills are completely denied constantly in those starting couple of dungeons.

This could be easily sorted by just programming the system to:

a) not create certain situations that are nearly impossible to overcome on the first couple of dungeons (i.e. more than two enemies per room, no "block all doors" traps on the first dungeon, introduce enemies that shoot projectiles only on the second dungeon, etc.)

b) not make the player get constantly stuck in clutter in the already very small rooms

c) and to make projectiles from enemies hit other enemies as well (this would feel much fair given that most of the time there is no space enough to dodge so many projectiles). It could even create infighting like in Doom. Now that would be fun, and funny, to see.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082361070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1708291600}
review: Не сбалансированная, затянутая, боёвка скучная. разрабы предлагают миллион раз бегать по одному данжу и умирать, так как чем дальше, тем гораздо сложнее и приходится постоянно умирать чуть чуть подняв уровень и так пока перс не начнёт оч сильно дамажить. урон который наносят враги и их сложность растёт гораздо быстрей чем эфективность персонажа. скучно становится на 2 часу игры. в итоге установил чит, чтоб хоть раз пройти, но даже с читом нудно пиздец. в игре 2 босса и у второго здоровье зависит от здоровья игрока, а у меня 100000 было и я пол часа убивал босса. после убийства выпала какая то херня, я её подобрал и написало, что открыт новый перс, но он не открылся. + есть комнаты где надо прыгать по выступам, это тупо затягивает игру до предела, даже был на локе, где если прыгнешь мимо, упадёшь на шипы и от туда нельзя выбраться, прыжки кривые и ты руинишь 40 минутный забег одной ошибкой. и ещё в игре уебанский шрифт, что программа ёлочка не может ни хера перевести. денег жалко, всего 6 часов поиграл :(

author: {'steamid': '76561197991329933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1821, 'last_played': 1707078851}
review:
I like the gameplay. Parrying and blocking is fun. Constructing weapons is fun. The main issues I have are the awful controls and the penalties for dying.

Moving in the game is just clunky. I am sick of losing combos because I got stuck on a box or a piece of one. Sometimes you have to swing 10 times to break a pot because the hit boxes are so wonky due to the 2d art style. The controls are also why I am deciding to leave a bad review because I am pretty pissed at my last run. I had a nice weapon that I spent HOURS crafting. It's gone now because I fell in a hole due to the terrible controls. You also lose some levels, money, and all of your equipment.  This leads to an absurd level of grinding, even for a rougelike. 

I've started over a few times thinking I could overcome the games frustrations but now I've realized that it is not worth the effort.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987043307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 2212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1333, 'playtime_at_review': 1655, 'last_played': 1712454233}
review:
Pros:
- Impressive Graphic
- Fun battle

Cons:
- Sh1tty Physics
- Sh1tty Platforming
- F**king annoying collision detection
- Rare Sh1tty Glitches that you can't beat the game

Once you've learned the core game mechanics, it goes well, but sh1tty physics and unfair RNG geometry sometimes make you piss off. Character movement is super stiff, and I easily get stuck by geometry and objects.

The more the level you go, there are lots of ESSENTIAL platforming sections, and you will get pissed off. It's not just "getting used to" level; it's just annoying and makes no sense.

But the game concept and the art style are good; I will not lie. It's not easy to recommend to my friends. It's sometimes fun, but sometimes really annoying, and the most annoying parts are unfair stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001631970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1251, 'last_played': 1703992798}
review: Absolutely loved everything about this game for the first 4 hours of game play and then boom, jump puzzles. Not just a few little timing jumps that are fun and challenging, nope not that. BIG GIANT F-YOU jump puzzles that might take you 30 minutes to complete only to get killed during your next encounter because it's a ROGUE like. I love rogue likes because they are difficult and quick. A jump puzzle sandwiched in between a lot of dying, rinse repeat just doesn't work, imo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154135669', 'num_games_owned': 848, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1133, 'last_played': 1703885711}
review:
Overall i had fun, Finished a dungeon 3 times. It's a competent dungeon crawler with very nice combat, reminiscent of dark messiah (you can parry, you can kick enemies into spikes or pits, you have some special abilities, etc.) and admittedly fun progression and skill system.
Enemies are varied, the spells and skills are cool enough you can focus on different playstyles. I absolutely adore the aesthetics and the plot (at least of the characters i played as, every character has a different story that unlocks as you progress) is surprisingly good for a dungeon crawler.
I would buy in on a discount, as the game has a few flaws that really sometimes left a sour taste in my mouth.
First big nitpick is that the progression system really awards playing like a coward. 80% of your progression is items and you lose them if you die, but there are chutes you can drop your items and they become available at the start of a new run. So they moment the levels start getting difficult, the best play is to drop all your good items down the chute and start over with your good items and grind the easy levels again.
The second thing and the one that almost made me quit is that each type of the dungeon has some jumping puzzle, that depending on the generation, is mandatory to progress. The jumping in this game is not fun, the action grinds to a halt as you wait for slow moving platforms to rise out of the walls and you still miss the jump because of the terrible jumping. Shout out to the last chapter that has a mandatory jumping puzzle that instakils you if you fail. 
Lastly, start of your run often depends on you (randomly) getting some skills that really seem like they should be by default, like a skill to parry ranged attacks, or not having your wands explode when you run out of ammo. If you are unlucky and never get them, the game will feel turbo clunky.
Overall, its much easier to criticise than to praise, and i want to repeat that the game is very good, and most of those problems are blemishes on one of the better dungeon crawlers i played in a good while. Except the jumping puzzles, i have no idea what they were thinking with those

author: {'steamid': '76561197994506042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1702175346}
review:
If your crank is Dark Messiah meets Daggerfall, then look no further.

Personally though, the switch from that sweet feeling of discovery to "Oh, ok now it's time to put in 50 more hours if I want to beat this game" was remarkably quick. There isn't a lot that goes into this, but I still feel like it's missing something. Some extra spice, like unlocks or a more tangible way to see progress; or just more persistent buffs would've helped immensely. Leveling up is all fine and dandy but it doesn't soften the blow when I lose a quarter of those every time I get knocked off the tree and hit every branch on the way down.

I do appreciate the dormroom-style vibe of the graphics, but ultimately I can't contend with the grind this game is asking for. Repeatedly grinding levels to upgrade wimpy perks into cumulatively slightly less wimpy perks just doesn't do it for me. I mostly feel sorry for the main character here, he got stuck in the most prodigious, state-of-the-art security complex packed floor to floor with deadly monsters and traps that eviscerate healthbars. Bro can't catch a break.

There wasn't any point where I felt particularly powerful or formidable. This felt more like a constant struggle against the specters of RNG and grind that I wasn't going to win. No reason I'd pick this over any of the other roguelikes in my library, sadly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061059605', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3508, 'last_played': 1704569983}
review:
You can play it forever, and still never unlock that [spoiler] jelloguy [/spoiler] damn it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995287117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1703962310}
review: I love to hate to break it to anyone, but this game is absolutely 100% solid freaking fun. Simple, yet consuming. I am in LOVE with the graphics. That on-the-border cartoon style that at the same time oozes realism (if you know, you know). Other titles have done this but failed, in my opinion, and yeah I am looking at you *title that starts with "B" and ends with "Orderlands".* Slasher's Keep, however, nails this art styling down and then somehow manages to superglue it to the base afterward without any trace. The randomization can be a bit repetitive for the first couple floors but I promise you it gets crazier the further you go. And you can always change the layout of your map at will, albeit it's a "cheat", as the game will tell you, but that's just it. The game literally TELLS you how to randomize your maps. The randomized encounters alone are enough, I mean I find myself feeling large and tall on one floor, only to find enemies that stomp me ruthlessly the next. It takes careful consideration and planning to navigate this game despite its simplicity and that is something I absolutely adore. The only gripes I have are that sometimes your personal hitbox can be difficult to manage, and that you cannot crouch. I'd really like to be able to duck beneath enemy swings, considering that blocking is entirely directional (also a quirk to the game that is a rarely-used feature these days)

author: {'steamid': '76561198844425721', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1703171798}
review:
[h1]Вполне неплохой рогалик про побег из фэнтези-тюрьмы[/h1]
[hr][/hr]
Игра раскрылась на 6ом часу на пониженной сложности. Именно на ней я советую проходить Slasher's Ceep в первый раз, так как в ней много различных комнат, ловушек, врагов и ситуаций, с которыми вы будете сталкиваться в первый раз и можете сильно разнервничаться [b]на высокой сложности[/b] ибо на ней [b]игра ОЧЕНЬ сложная[/b].
А так, на [b]сложности пониже[/b], чувствуется прогресс, когда с каждой попыткой ты продвигаешься все дальше и дальше, встречаются интересные уровни, случаются забавные ситуации и [b]ПЕРКИ НАЧИНАЮТ РАБОТАТЬ[/b], т.к. с каждым новым забегом игрок качает свой уровень, а значит и характеристики с перками.
Радует приятный и изобретательный визуал, понятная и приятная боевка, разнообразие оружия, зелий, брони и возможность сделать свою палку-махалку.
Оптимизация радует, многие пишут про баги и ошибки, но я не встретил ни одного серьезного за, почти, 10 часов в игре.
[hr][/hr]
[h1]Интересный и залипательный рогалик в необычном сеттинге. Игра мне очень даже понравилась, денег не жалею, рекомендую к покупке.[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198075564038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 2830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2743, 'last_played': 1702902618}
review: Кроме уникального визуального стиля и занятной системы крафта в игре нет ничего стоящего. Абсолютно отсутствует баланс повышения сложности. Бесполезность 80% перков в игре. Упоротый генератор создаёт комнаты с невменяемым буллет-хеллом (смотрим про отсутствие баланса сложности - такая комната может попасться вам уже на начальных этажах). Чудовищный гриндволл, о который вы будете биться (читаем про бесполезность большинства перков) ОЧЕНЬ долго. Боёвка - это отдельная тема, я не знаю о чём думал разработчик... Похоже на фехтование двух, простите, паралитиков. Не ведитесь на визуал, проходите мимо.

review:
A flawed gem of a rogue-like rpg dungeon crawler, it has some very interesting mechanics that usually come together, but when they don't it falls rather flat. Wands feel mostly useless, the difficulty jump between levels feels a bit much and the way skills work is a bit weird. You get them from items and then lock them in by leveling up, I think?

I think a good update or sequel could fix things.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029582118', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1660363034}

author: {'steamid': '76561198303945313', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1702445027}
review:
[h2] Would be a great potential dungeon crawler mixed with rogue like elements, if not by terrible design, balancing choices and a lackluster ending.  5 / 10 [/h2]

[h3] The good [/h3]

A roguelike Dungeon Crawler with lots of action with some puzzles, which is quite challenging regarding skill, have a mysterious story and encourages you to go on exploration without feeling ultra boring.

Nice systems like forge custom gear (even the looks/pieces) and the vault which gives less punishment for dying and varied strategies for enemies.

I felt like LoG (Legends of Grimrock 2), which you should try if you don't know what it is and you agree with me until the end of this review.

[h3] The bad [/h3]

The good experience is true for the first 4 levels. Or the first boss.

[h3] The worse[/h3]

From level 5, the game becomes ultra punishing on normal difficulty with huge balancing issues. First, remember you are not allowed to LOAD GAME or restart from the same floor if you die. You kinda die with 1 or 2 shots from most enemies no matter if you are heavily armoured or not, and there will be obligatory rooms with a lot of ranged characters, and you will simply waste a lot of time for something to go wrong and have to start over.

It not only becomes ultra hard on a bad way in combat, reflexes and decision making, but it becomes a frustrating platforming puzzle game. And no, no matter how many times you will restart or what difficulty setting you put, you have to face the same rooms to make the same jumps on every single run. Which kinda breaks the rogue like part. And no, they could make it a few jumps or optional to get some nice treasure, but nope, it's like 30 obligatory consecutive jumps, with some if you miss ONCE you will end on a spiked huge floor or have to start all over again.

I played until level 5 on normal, then got smashed. Started over on easy and finished it only to see the ending. I don't care bout achievements (disabled on easy mode). Unfortunately the journey from the 5th level and beyond ending is quite lackluster. There are many death pits and traps that feel unfair, which mixed with having to start over from the first floor kinda becomes a boring GRIND quickly.

The bosses are also not good design. Either they are huge chunks of HP or you simply abuse a cheesy bs way (feels like a bug but it's easy to correct) to kill them without any challenge. It felt like all or nothing on that regard.

I also heard some fanboys defending this game with thoughts like "Changing the type of gaming entirely was needed" or "You can close the game because it doesn't save until you click on respawn", which is kinda strange, because people DON'T like to buy a game expecting a genre and discovering they are playing another completely different AFTER they can't refund anymore. It also points to repetition and boredom. Also, suggesting to CHEESE the game to avoid it's harsh rules kinda proves that the game itself is flawed, doesn't?

Which is a shame, because the game has great ideas and was made by a single person. Maybe that was the breaking point, no matter how talented you are, there is the need to share your ideas with many other point of views, even if it goes against your own.

[h2]  TLDR: I would only recommend this game to truly masochists and at a huge discount, and this coming from someone who loves and finished ALL Dark Souls and intend on finishing / replaying them again.  [/h2]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970815344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 937, 'last_played': 1702239931}
review:
At current - this is a potentially great game that's plagued by game breaking bugs. I strongly recommend against unless this is on sale or this gets some serious patching. I've had this in my library for awhile now, and every time I come back I hope the bugs are fixed. At this point it has yet to be, and I'm done being frustrated with it.

Art style is great, music is good, general game play mechanics and combat are fun. Enemies and items look cool, the crafting system is pretty decent. Everything goes to shit though when you've been playing for hours only to find out you can't progress further due to map bugs. I've had literal dozens of times where an exit doesn't spawn or a key doesn't spawn. The discussion forums are littered with folks having the same issues and while some people have some minor fixes (i.e spend more time looking around) those solutions didn't work for me. I spent an hour searching a 4 room level again and again in hopes I missed something. I reset the map 3 or 4 times and this still didn't fix the issue.  The entirety of times I've had this issue I've had to die or reset my game, and it reaches a point where you just want to play and not have to keep resetting your progress.

Sadly, this could've been a great one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256250926', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3820, 'last_played': 1699105770}
review:
Es un juego que me resulto dentro de todo entretenido. Tiene cosas interesantes como su sistema de crafteo único donde ensamblas las armas con los piezas que encuentras y le das el aspecto que a vos te parezca, pero lamentablemente es un juego en beta totalmente abandonado. Lleno de bugs por todos lados y de todo tipo, incluso errores de niveles donde si querés avanzar en la partida tenés que usar códigos para acceder al siguiente nivel (proporcionados por su desarrollador).

Debido al estado en el que se encuentra, no lo recomiendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048780660', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1421, 'last_played': 1620066371}
review:
This game can be seriously addicting.

Reminds me of old dungeon hack and slashes - there is always a sense of progression through the permanent traits / putting your items through the bin back to the start.  Only issue I had was when I accidentally bit off more than I could chew and didn't put my gear through the bin-  all of a sudden I was underlevelled and struggled to continue to the point it seemed unforgiving.  That being said that is a rogue long dungeon run and I had an amazing time regardless.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973979510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1700941609}
review:
As a Dark Messiah of Might and Magic Lover, this is a dream come true!

The combat is rewarding to learn and I haven't had many games that make me laugh and get motivated to be better when I die. Even falling into a hole while blocking and moving backwards is a valuable lesson to learn.

It is so fun to explore and the custom weapon crafting is nuts, every game should have that! You can pixel-perfectly customize your weapons VISUALLY and ability wise. Such a lovely idea.

The secrets, the alchemy, the perma unlocks, the graphic and atmosphere is pure nostalgic bliss for me.
And as someone who usually turns of ingame music right away to put my own chill music on, I am pleased to say that the music in this game is top notch and never distracts from whats going on.

The blue quest giver has one of the greatest looping monologues I have ever heard and he sounds like one of the beatles :D

Eating spiders for magic wand charges? Check.
Sexy Orc posters? Check.
"Kicking" enemies into spikes/abyss? Check.
Different charged attacks and attack patterns? Check.
Jumping puzzles, traps, shops, secrets, keys, chests.... CHECK, CHECK, CHECK!

My only gripe so far is that some things the game wants you to be very exact but it isn't programmed as exact as it wants you to be. As someone who has done all jumping Puzzles in Guild Wars 2 and loving many jumpingpuzzle type games, it is QUITE frustrating when your character decides to not jump, or just fall through one of them plates that extend from the wall. Or when the interactable area of a lever is NOT the bright red handle, but instead where it is mounted on the wall, leading to many frustrating deaths before I found out where I had to "aim" to interact. (Come on, you literally made the handle red, dev.)

That being said, I see myself put hundreds of hours into this game and return even years later for "just one more floor"...

author: {'steamid': '76561198011086924', 'num_games_owned': 1083, 'num_reviews': 436, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1696523851}
review:
TL/DR: REALLY good Roguelike that is done better than others and rocks my stiff socks!

I usually complete a game before reviewing but this game is the definition of a GEM! Game feel is KEY and boy does this have it in spades! It is a Roguelike but a forgiving one since you only lose 1 level on death, a wad of gold, all your items (that you didn't "save"), and a hit to your skills and attributes. This system works well since you are still making progress even though you have to restart the game. Save points can be found at random but that only saves that run so if you die it still resets completely. Some RLs get it all wrong but this one gets it all right (though it would be nice to manually save a living run at any time :(    I could make a lengthy review one all the awesome quirks about this game but you probably are already not reading this far since it is long so leave me a steam point reaction and go play this da#n game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198078350211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1697069511}
review:
Awesome dungeon crawler game! Good mechanics, great levels and obstacles, combat is a little boring at first (not very unique I mean) but once you get into the groove of it becomes fun, aesthetics are REALLY good but the music sucks if I'm being frank, just boring guitar strumming and picking. 

Overall a strong 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198010693962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1694763696}
review:
It gets repetitive fast. The lack of enemy diversity and gameplay diversity quickly makes the run feel boring very quickly. Insignificant and rare upgrades also make building a character feel a little stale. The game slows down when you have to do annoying puzzle sections as well, doing them once or twice is fun and all, but in a roguelite where you die often doing them for the 4th time made me want to never return to this game again. 

It's a shame, because there's a lot the game does right and is fun to play around with. But ultimately, I couldn't finish the game and moved on to something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198427588208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1695439788}
review: Got soft locked lmao. On a more constructive note, the game feels as though it still needs some time to bake in the oven. The 2D sprite approach is nice, except it ruins the ability to understand enemy attack range and hitboxes from everything. I found myself multiple times colliding with walls and gates that seemed to make no sense, only to get stuck and take unnecessary damage from enemies. If I break open a box, I sometimes can't reach what's in the box. If things break and enemies or you are caught on broken pieces that are still moving, things go flying all over the place. Combat feels slow and clunky. Whenever I try to "parry" an enemy's attack, sometimes it feels as if they eat the attack and I still take damage regardless. When the game is fun, it is pretty fun, but for the most part it still feels early access.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978260185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1878, 'last_played': 1710066449}
review: 这个游戏只能算作小游戏！最初购买这个游戏，是看见了游戏网站的介绍，这种漫画画风的第一人称地城探险，的确很吸引人。游戏是在一座塔里，你开始是从一个牢房里出发，一路打杀升级装备，但是难度会越来越高，我也不知道这个游戏里的塔有多少层，是否能通关。怪物随机掉落的武器是非常有趣的，有传统的刀剑也有一些奇怪的物品，而且你还可以收集材料在某些特定房间甚至可以制作签名武器。在这个塔里每一层都要找到钥匙才能前往下一层，有些房间还会有精英怪甚至boss出现，他的地图和出现的怪物每次开始都是随机的，玩家角色死亡则游戏失败从头开始，《Slasher'sKeep》就是这么一个有些难但是趣味十足的小游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198086030766', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1412, 'last_played': 1690999366}
review: 6/10. Very fun game that plays like a single player Dark and Darker. Some of the enemy types feel a little repetitive and all of the flying projectile enemies are unfun to fight against. The fun of the game comes in the looting more than the combat but it offers unique enough character building to still make it worth trying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072329230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 35947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1203, 'playtime_at_review': 11640, 'last_played': 1712389848}
review: Fight your way up the keep, get knocked back down to the bottom, try again from nothing.  Much like mining games, I'm surprised how very satisfying the process is!  I finished the game, and then found myself starting five new games, returning to it again and again despite having other games with much higher production value waiting to be played.  Go figure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198191835033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1690386375}
review:
You cannot progress through the dungeon smoothly. You MUST start again and again until you have enough power-up to continue the game. It is a farming game first and foremost.

If you wanted a cool little adventure/exploration/puzzle game, go elsewhere. Here you will kill the same HP bags in a loop.

In addition, there is no difficulty mode (for who knows what reason?), the game is stuck in kind of "hardcore difficulty" in which you lose all your equipment and go back floor 1 if you die.

So here is a game that will not please everyone. It's for tryharders only.

review:
I'm not the one who complains too much about bugs.. But i've encountered a gamebreaking one where you can't use any weapons. Reloading doesn't work, so your save is more or less ruined.
Made a post about it a couple of days ago, no reply. When doing some research, it appears that the bug has been around for a while (1 year+), so i'd probably stay clear of this game unless you're a gambling fellow.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996066650', 'num_games_owned': 832, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1690401944}
review:
Great game, you in a low dungeon, explore and discover weapon, armour, accessories all with perks that can aid your fight. Leveling system is cool, bit unique compared to the normal stuff. 

 Feels great to get through the first dungeon and then you are like Oh my god there is a new dungeon, and it feels different, its got different mechanics and man it made me feel like I actually progressed somewhere. 

Very satisfying to build weapons, create your own play style, try different methods. Combat is good, direction guided swinging does different attacks. 

 Man there is alot more to the game, the more you level up, the more excited you get to test things out and be more powerful! Well done devs, look forward to more

author: {'steamid': '76561198071003040', 'num_games_owned': 864, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1688919924}
review:
I've played as many of these retro-ish/low-techish dungeon crawlers as I could find, and Slasher's Keep is an easy top 5. The combat feels good and fair without being easily exploitable or too easy, the room layouts and enemy AI are dynamic enough to stay fresh over time, the abilities, stats, and equipment all feel impactful and improve at a comfortable pace, and the push attack (which is swinging your bag of loot at the enemy) is super useful and incredibly satisfying to kill enemies with. 

I adore the weapon crafting system and love making a funny face-on-a-stick and then bashing enemies with it. This is a system i deeply wish to see more games expand on.

I also love the way the game handles death and resets - you only lose 25% of your levels and money, and are able to send items back to your future self as you go. Meaning, every character will *eventually* be very powerful over several runs and you're always experiencing a satisfying acceleration of gameplay. 

[b]some minor complaints:[/b]
- i wish i could jump over waist-high fences and boxes. this especially annoying when enemies push a box into the only path and my only option is to just walk into it at different angles until it moves. it's still kind of fun when this happens though because it creates some weird and unusual situations with enemy positioning

- i wish i could crouch. honestly i think every first person game should have a crouch even if it doesn't provide any practical value. it's just super weird feeling like i don't have knees. this /can/ contribute to a retro game feel and is tolerable when a game never gives you a reason to crouch, but this game puts lots of things on shelves at shin-height and has enemies shoot projectiles through fence holes that would be cool to crouch under. not a big deal overall. 

- i wish the deflect skill was a default feature. you don't have a real defense against ranged attacks without it, besides 'kill them first'. maybe make it so you can timed-parry projectiles by default and have deflect enable blocking them?

- the minimap is generally pretty hard to read. increasing the negative space between rooms and giving an indication of door direction would go a long way imo

- wands aren't effective enough. they all feel GREAT and look cool - but equip time is too long to use during normal combat, and damage is too low to pick off most enemies from afar. this limits wand use to a few annoying flying enemies and to pulling aggro. could be a skill issue though.

[b]things i like (not a complete list)[/b]
- overall level design makes the most out of few assets. environmental hazards and enemy types, the delightful push attack, and the range of melee strategies between fast and slow weapons and their various power swings/stabs, all combine to create a suprisingly dynamic experience

- only game i've played so far that was super consistent and fair with the aimed-parries thing. it feels great to skill your way through being cornered by four enemies. most dungeon crawley games in this genre are more than content to just kill you and say better luck next time when you mess up or the game decides to mean to you about enemy spacing/positioning.

- the weapon crafting system is such a treat. i need more of this

- the progression system is a welcome change of pace from the full resets of other games in the genre. most of these are either way too easy or way too hard, and it's difficult to keep slogging through the hard ones when you don't make much progress. Slasher's Keep goes fully in the opposite direction, [i]arguably not punishing you enough[/i] for dying, giving you a lot of meaningful choices about what to send down the chute for your next run and when to take risks, and guaranteeing a satisfying sense of progression and empowerment without getting too easy at any point.

- the Permalearn system is a fun one. every 2 levels you get a 'permalearn' point, allowing you to take any of the perks you've acquired so far (randomly every other level, and from equipped items) and learn 1 level of that perk forever. You could decide that you like the way this mace gives you fiery attacks, and gain fiery attacks **forever**. or maybe you want to refill your wands when you eat spiders? the dungeon is your oyster. there's lots of perks to choose from and permalearning skills makes it feel like every character is a multi-run project

- the shop keeper is easily top 5 in videogames for me. what a lovable dude. 

- and more(tm) i like this game. play it if you like first-person dungeon crawlers.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998939357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1689082261}
review:
# 概要

Version 1.36 時点

一人称視点+近接攻撃でダンジョンを探索するアクションゲーム。
ダンジョンマスター、キングスフィールド、シャドウタワーなどが好きな人にはお勧め。
ただ、上にあげたようなゲームのように若干もっさりとしていて独特な操作感なので人を選ぶ感じ。
キャラクターが素直に動いてくれないから難しいタイプのアクション。

アクションは、シンプルで分かりやすいが、独特で簡単とは言い難い部分がある。
武器の振りが遅くて防御が間に合わなかったり、攻撃の当たり判定が良く分からないでミスしたり、パリィの条件が分からなくて被弾したりする事がある。
まあ、システムを理解できていないだけかもしれないが。
敵が一撃で倒せない場合、こちらが先手を取ると防御が間に合わずに被弾してしまう事が多くしっかりパリィしてから攻撃した方が無難。
こんな感じで、全体的にスローペースなゲーム。

システムになれるまでとキャラクターが強くなるまでは死にまくる。
始めに階層で死にまくりました。
死ぬとレベルが下がり、装備を全て失い、お金が減る
しかし、ポイントを割り振って覚えたスキルは忘れなかったり、アイテムシュートに入れた装備は消えなかったりするので徐々に強くなるシステム。
強くなるまで時間が掛かるので上手くないと辛いけれど。
また、クリア後のダンジョンは、難易度が上がって油断できなかったりと、強くなったら楽過ぎて緊張感が無くなる事もない。
敵がどこまで強くなるかは分からないが。
そして、クリア後のダンジョンで死んでしまうと、敵が強すぎて全く立て直せなくなるけど。

スキルは、装備に付いているかレベルアップ時にランダムで覚えられる。
ただ、こうやって覚えたスキルは、装備を外したり死んだりすると忘れてしまう。
しかし、レベルアップ時に得られるスキルポイントを振ると永続的に使えるようになる。
また、スキルポイントはスキルのレベルを上げるのにも使える。
スキルが実用的になるにはある程度のレベルが必要なため、レベルを上げるのを優先するか新しいスキルを覚えるか悩むことになる。

キャラクターは、はじめから1つだけスキルを持っている。
これは作成時にランダムで決まるみたい。
そしてこのスキルは、後から覚えられないようなのである程度吟味した方が良いかもしれない。

2層目以降に現れるアイテムシュートに入れた装備は、次の周回で使うことが出来る。
レベルが上がると、落ちるアイテムの質も良くなるようでいつかはクリアできる感じ。
落ちている装備には、ランダムでスキルが付いていたりボーナスが付いているものがある。
そのため、アイテムを集めるハクスラ的要素もある。

慣れないうちは、HP回復手段が乏しくて難しいと思うかもしれない。
しかし、アビリティなどで改善する事が出来るし、それ以外の回復手段はそれなりに豊富にある。
回復薬や、テーブルの上にある肉などで回復することが出来る。
そして、ダンジョン内の所々に居る虫を食べる事でも回復出来る。
こういうノリが好きな人にもお勧め。

敵は、決まった数しかいない。
そのため、経験値稼ぎのような事は出来ない。
ただ、一定時間内に敵を殺すとキルストリークとなり獲得経験値を増やすことが出来る。
細かい探索を後回しにして敵を殺しまわった方が、経験値効率は良い。
タイムアタックなどに向いているシステムかもしれない。

足場が消える所をジャンプして渡らなければいけない箇所がある。
死んで繰り返すゲームでこれはとても面倒。
これだけで、低評価にしたいぐらい。
ただ、多ボタンマウスやゲームパッドを使えばそんなに難しくはないと思う。
最後の最後に、ジャンプを失敗すると死亡する所がある。
自分は、3回中2回失敗して死亡した。
どうしてこんな所に配置するのか。

(一回クリアすると?)、開始時にダンジョンの階層数を指定できる。
そのため、思う存分、キャラクターを強くしたり、強い装備を作れる。
もっとも、1回クリアするのに時間が掛かったのとアンロックなどもあり無限階などに挑戦する気になるかは分からない。

# 操作

左クリック: 攻撃
右クリック: 防御
F: アイテム袋によるスタン+ノックバック(ダメージなし)
Shift: 走る
Space: ジャンプ
X: 武器を構える
C: 魔法の杖を構える
Q: 武器と杖の切り替え
1-8: アイテムショートカット
B: アビリティ画面を開く
Tab: 装備画面を開く

攻撃は、通常攻撃と溜め攻撃がある。
溜め攻撃は、3倍ぐらいの威力だが隙が大きい。
溜め攻撃は、方向キーを押しながら溜めると横振りや突きなどが出せる。
モーションによる違いは、ダメージや射程が変わるようだがよくわからない。
パリィしてくる敵が居るので適切に出すとパリィを防ぐ事が出来るのかもしれない。
少なくとも、対応するスキルがあると威力などが変わる。
敵の顔に攻撃を当てるとダメージが増える。
また、条件が良く分からないけどスニークボーナスもある。

防御は、ボタンを押しっぱなしにして敵の攻撃を正面にとらえると出来る。
防御をしっかりして戦うと、殺陣をしている感じがして好き。
シャドウタワーよりかは、戦っている感じがするかも。

スタミナの類は無いので、攻撃はずっと出していられるし、制限なく走ることが出来る。

アイテム袋による攻撃で敵をノックバックさせ、フィールド上になる棘や穴へ吹き飛ばすと即死させる事が出来る。
また、スタンさせて敵の攻撃を中断させる事も出来る。
ちなみに、敵を穴に落として殺してもアイテムはしっかり取れる。
シャドウタワーだったか、レアアイテムが奈落に落ちて泣きを見るなんて事はないので安心です。

魔法の杖で遠距離攻撃が出来る。
ただ、杖のチャージ回数分しか攻撃できないので連発は出来ない。
スキルを強化していくと、回数を増やせたり、回復させたり出来るようになる。

# 基本能力

- Strength: 攻撃力とHP
- Agility: クリティカル率とアーマー
- Intelligence: クリティカルダメージ、魔法の杖のダメージ、アイテムの値段、経験値
に影響する。

また、防具を装備することで
- Armour
が上昇する。

レベルアップ時に、4ポイント貰え好きに割り振れる。
クエストを達成することでもポイントが貰える事がある。
しかし、クエストは、クエスト自体が無かったり、達成条件が難しくて達成できなかったりでなかなか難しい。

 # 装備

装備は、
- Helmet
- Shoulder Armour
- Chest Armour
- Glove
- Leg Armour
- Boots
- Amulet
- Ring
- Weapon
- Wand
と装備箇所が豊富。
盾が無いのがさみしいけど。
装備画面が主だが見た目にも反映される。

武器には、
- Short Sword
- Long Sword
- Axe
- Mace
の種類があり、射程・振りの速さ・威力が違う。
特定の種類にしか影響しないスキルもある。

インベントリは、アイテムの大きさによって占有率が変わるタイプ。
容量は、あまり大きくない。
もう少し多いとより好みだった。
斧やメイスは、ショートソードの3倍ほど容量を取るがその利点が無いのが残念。
まあ、大きいアイテムにメリットがあるゲームをやった覚えがないけど。

武器は、特定の場所で作成する事が出来る。
必須のパーツ2つと追加の2～4個のパーツで作る。
パーツをどこに付けるか見た目をこだわる事が出来る。

残念ながら3D酔いしやすい人には向かない。
ただ、視野角(Field of View)を調整出来たり、歩行時の揺れをなくす等のオプションはある。

ちなみに始めは牢屋の中からスタートする。
どうやって抜け出したら良いか迷ったが、仕組みが分かれば突っ込みを入れたくなるようなオチ。
シャドウタワーなので初めに後ろに下がると死ぬのと同じようなノリを感じる。
さらに余談だが、セーブのアイコンがフロッピーなので古いゲームを意識しているのかもしれない。

成人向け要素があるとなっているが、女性キャラの初期装備が下着姿だったり(日本人好みではないと思うし、装備画面でしか見えない)、
オークかゴブリンのグラビアポスターが所々に張ってあったりする感じ。ｳﾋｮ-
また、首が切れるゴア表現もあり。

正式リリース後に買ったのですが、ゲームを終了すると高頻度でクラッシュするというバグがあります。
実害はないようですが気になります。
自分の環境だけかもしれませんが。

author: {'steamid': '76561198102869207', 'num_games_owned': 201, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1226, 'last_played': 1684240595}
review:
When you wake up, you feel strange. You find yourself in a prison and you don't remember anything. All you know is that the bars separating you from freedom are very shaky. But when you pry them open, you realize that the bars will be the last thing that separates you from true freedom. So open the chest and equip yourself with what the house has given you. As you enter the first door, you will realize that your journey will be a long one. 

The game is very smooth in terms of gameplay. In terms of appearance, the game is original. The humour is also original, and it weaves its sarcastic style through the entire game. The occasional enemy bugs are really minimal and do not interfere with the game. The difficulty is balanced and the game gives nothing away for free.

For me, I can recommend the game to beginners in the roguelike genre as well as experienced players. I wish a lot of success and few deaths. Although you will still die.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999928394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 7417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5144, 'last_played': 1682971857}
review:
This game is a hidden gem. So I was bored one day and asked ChatGPT for a lesser known roguelike game which features interesting meta-currency usage. And boy does this describe Slasher's Keep so well. 

The game feels super unforgiving at first when you die the first few times. But then you start to understand how to manage your stats and your gold and your items in preparation for your death. It's just so damn satisfying "gaming" the system.

What I dislike is the lack of enemy variety, lack of biome variety, lack of content overall. Probably the biggest hold-back for this game is the lack of modding support. I feel like this would bring so much life to this game if modding support was available from the start. Such a waste.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971177676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 2441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2441, 'last_played': 1680918966}
review:
ゆるいアートスタイルが特徴の一人称視点ローグライトアクション。
危険な罠を避け、モンスターを撃破しながら牢獄からの脱出を目指す。

アクションは非常にシンプルというかオールドスクールな造りで、WASD移動とダッシュ/ジャンプくらいしかない。戦闘は近接がメインとなるが、魔法のワンドを銃っぽく使って戦うこともできる。キックの代わりに荷物袋での殴打が可能で、敵を突き飛ばして落下させたり壁面スパイクに突き刺して敵を即死させ、周囲の環境を利用して戦うことも可能。

階層が進むにつれて敵の強さが大幅にアップし、防御力が弱いとワンミスで死亡することもあるため、道中での装備強化が必須。装備はランダムドロップなので、アクションの腕前もさることながら引きの強さもゲームの進行を左右する。死ぬとスタート地点に連れ戻されステータスに少しペナルティがあるが、装備品は死ぬ前にマップ上にあるダストシュートに入れておけば、リスタート時に宝箱から取り出して持っていくことが可能になっている。進行状況によっては無理に進めて装備を全てを失うよりも、強い装備品をダストシュートに入れて早々に撤退(死亡)するのが吉なケースも多い。強力な武器を装備しているが防具が弱い時などは、進むか退くか悩みどころ。

中盤から消える足場の連続ジャンプが必要だったり（落下ダメージが無いのが救い）、敵や罠の配置が異様にいじわるな時がある（マップが自動生成なため簡単な時もある）、良い装備品が出ない時がある等、誰でもすぐ簡単にクリアできるように作られていない。繰り返しプレイして、遊び方や有利な進め方を覚えていく必要があり、見た目のゆるさに反してしっかりとした攻略が必要な難易度になっている。ステージクリアごとに表示される「プレイヤーが投獄されるまでのストーリー」もアートスタイルと裏腹にダークな内容。

自分は２周したら飽きてしまい、パーマデスモードや大きな規模のダンジョンに挑戦する気はおきなかったが、値段分以上に楽しませてもらった。ちょっと歯ごたえのあるローグライトを探していて、アクションの得意な人におすすめ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198072595998', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1678906806}
review:
Dawno się tak dobrze nie bawiłem. Grę ukończyłem po 6 godzinach grania. Rozgrywka jest bardzo przyjemna i wciągająca. Grafika komiksowa jest piękna, nie dziwię się, że coraz więcej gier i animacji po nią sięga. Oczywiście są w grze małe błędy, ale nie przeszkadzają w rozgrywce. Niestety według mojej opinii gra jest dość droga w porównaniu do tego co oferuje. 6 godzin to nie jest jakiś górnolotny wynik. Gra pozostawia w nas w dużym niedosycie, mamy ochotę na więcej! Możliwe, że ponownie sięgnę po ten tytuł, chociaż nigdy nie gram w ukończone przeze mnie gry. 

Plusy:
- ciekawa rozgrywka
- fajne lvl
- piękna grafika
- dobra optymalizacja
- spójność

Minusy:
- krótka przygoda
- brak urozmaicenia w muzyce
- brak większej ilości bossów 

Reasumując, grę serdecznie polecam. Jest to wyjątkowy tytuł, który spodoba się większej grupie odbiorców.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071085750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1708898696}
review: Very cool game. As others have said, the footwork is a little clunky with destroyed objects having collision and stairs being a little wonky and sometimes the broken crates can obscure certain items. All that being said though - I spent a lot of time dreaming of a first person dungeon crawler similar to this and this bad boy delivers. The parry mechanic is very unique and takes a bit to get used to, but it is fun. The rigged player and enemy sprites create a surreal 2.5D experience. All the objects have 3D collision with nice sprite sheets to boot. The lighting is nice with the soft textures and grainy shadows. It gives me nostalgia without being ugly - in fact its beautiful and clean. Lots of little details. Screenshots don't do it justice.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973742846', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 5723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3933, 'last_played': 1678579585}
review:
TENTATIVE RECOMMEND
STILL JANKY
It's a pretty cool first person dungeon crawl adventure roguelite, with a neat inheritance mechanic for skills and some items.  Also has a simple but kinda neat weapon building mechanic.
Attacking is either melee or zapping with wands.  Though, you could shoot magic out your weapon if you have the right skill.
There are over 60 different skills that I can find in wiki's, but there are more.  Many are very fun, and I think you can get them all over time.  

I got 14 crash errors from what might be every time I quit the game.
Item overlap will hide things, but if you keep an eye on your map at least you will find the important items.

The most annoying thing I found was the platform jumping you end up being forced to do (eventually).
BUT I did mostly figure it out and it's not too bad now, but I kinda still hate it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164286162', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1248, 'last_played': 1677121388}
review:
9/10.
I had read a review on here giving the game a negative rating because the guy had died from slipping on a severed head after buying expensive gear from a well-dressed mole person, so I immediately proceeded to purchase and download. In conclusion, as indie rogue-lites go, Slasher's Keep is pretty gd good, especially considering that the game is first-person and has a great aesthetic. And yep, you  can even get lots of merry lols from the good old slip n' trip on some severed heads. It's also refreshing to see a game that treats the mole-people as *people*; they *do* have fantastic sartorial sensibilities, as well as a polite demeanour and reasonable prices.

review: I have really enjoyed my time with this game. Admittedly, I am not exactly good at it, but I have enjoyed it's mechanics and style nonetheless. Only major critique is the lack of audio options in-game. Would love to see an output selection, and a dialogue volume slider separate from the rest of the non-musical audio tracks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150274913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1696493184}
review:
An extremely charming game that is well worth the price. Extremely unique art style (these days) that makes the entire concept work better, and fixes a lot of the problems first person games like this have. Because the 2D models move like its the OG Doom, blocking attacks and responding with your own is extremely fluid and fun, and everything feels fair. Attacks that should miss generally miss, attacks that should hit generally hit (which is a disappointingly HUGE issue in other games), the magic is interesting and satisfying. 

My only complaint is the huge difficulty curve. Unless you have king luck, you are generally not kitted enough to clear bosses, ever. I can only compare this to other dungeon crawler roguelikes (and I do ackowledge that I'm low level and low play time, much of the game is balanced around player level), so I look to games such as Pixel Dungeon and Brogue for the answer. Having randomized loot allows for the 1% and 0.1% drops that would allow the player to obtain equipment/weapons suitable for actually dealing with bosses in a timely manner. An enchantment system to complement the forge system would also be helpful (enchantments are entirely non-permanent, cannot be carried between runs, but are subsequently more common and more varied, and perhaps could stack with one another).

However, that said, the game is coming along nicely. Well worth the purchase, it looks like and plays like exactly what you'd expect from the advertising. Protips: 1- Read the controls in the launcher box, there is no way to adjust them in game. 2- Stand on boxes and the like while holding them with a Kinetic wand to make platforming a little easier. It's not a bug, its a feature.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984018817', 'num_games_owned': 669, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 1832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1832, 'last_played': 1673459835}
review:
Немного шероховатая, но интересная игра.
Мне понравилась общая атмосфера подземелья и визуальный стиль(за спрайты с разных сторон отдельный респект).
Есть конечно небольшие косяки с генерацией уровней в последнем биоме(чтош REROLL в помощь), но в остальном идея весьма интересная.

Надеюсь разработчики не забросят идею делать ружлайк данджен кроулер в дарк фентези и порадуют обновлениями или новой игрой!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030629896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 1131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1675364434}
review:
A tough one to review. The beginning can seem very unforgiving and you may get the feeling that you are making no progress at all and keep getting killed and losing all your stuff. For this reason I came very close to uninstalling the game on several occasions, but in the end I'm quite happy and pleased I stuck with it, Once you learn and understand the basic mechanics of the game like blocking/parrying and dumping all your items down the item chute and starting over as the enemies start to get too overpowered compared to your level/items the game gets a lot more enjoyable. 

An exploit everyone should probably know is closing the game with ALT+F4 when getting killed so you don't have to start all over and can then just load your last save and continue from there. Obviously not how it is supposed to be played, but it does make the game more fun and enjoyable.

A deal breaker for some so a heads up: there is no option to rebind keys, but at least you can use Autohotkey or similar third party programs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009200239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1674901262}
review:
你所有的能力都建立在装备上，属性点的主要作用就是让你能穿更好的装备。
然后一旦装备因为某些原因没了，你刷了多少个周目都没用，一切从头来。
看上去是个ROG地牢，实际上就是刷刷刷。而且比刷刷刷游戏还要差，刷刷刷至少不会因为一个手滑卖掉装备就直接完蛋。
什么你说技能，好武器和差武器的区别就是一刀打死和5-6刀打死，技能有毛用啊？

author: {'steamid': '76561197970538611', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 241, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1673589285}
review:
This is one of those games that is so shockingly good that as an FPS aficionado you are amazed you'd never heard of it before, so you end up playing it for nine hours straight.

...Until you hit the first boss, the skill ceiling skyrockets and your enjoyment plummets. You die without touching its health bar because it has really vague hit-boxes so getting close enough to strike is suicide (you have wands but they are ***), you have to start all over losing most of your weapons and experience, and you suddenly realize you are playing another grind-fest disguised as a dungeon crawler.

I also couldn't figure out the save-system for the life of me: there is one on every floor that I assumed meant I could save my progress, turn the game off and go run an errand, but when I booted the game back up to continue it dropped me back on the first floor(?)

I suppose the closest comparison would be Heavy Bullets, another BS shooter with a procedural-generated feel (all the rooms are cells that get rearranged like a slide puzzle each run.) The jumping mechanic is also floaty and super inaccurate; there are several areas where precision leaping is required to access secrets and it's a total crap-shoot whether you a) barely make the jump, b) almost make the jump but fall off the lip even though you did everything right, or c) don't jump in time and fall off the starting ledge like a total putz.

Can't in good conscience recommend a game with such a harsh and obvious difficulty spike at the first boss. Honest question: are we about done with bosses in first person shooters? This isn't 1995. Give me an arena with a swarm of enemies from all sides, or better yet, a quick-time event. I mean, all games are is just mashing buttons anyway.

Score: 9 out of 10
-1 point for each unfair death
Final score: - 7 out of 10

Go play Delver instead. A nice, gentle difficulty curve and, like, one boss. At the end. Where he belongs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015744050', 'num_games_owned': 536, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2395, 'last_played': 1670432976}
review:
Глядя на трейлер Slasher's Keep может создаться впечатление, что перед Вами бодренький, юморной, хорошо скроенный и отлично нарисованный Dungeon Crawler, с элементами рогалика и приколюхами в стиле Dark Messiah, с толканием врагов в пропасти, острые шипы и костры

И чисто технически, все так и есть... Все, кроме ожидаемого фана от игры

Дело в том что атмосфера трейлера держится эдак до этажа третьего. А дальше Slasher's Keep из проекта явно вдохновленного Dark Messiah с добавлением своих идей и фишек, резко превращается в TES IV Oblivion

Но если увидев название Oblivion Вам в голову пришла хорошая сторона IV свитков с их размахом, обилием квестов, персонажей и множества локаций

То нет, начинайте ловить вьетнамские флешбеки темной стороны TES IV, где выходя с гоблином шаманом раз на раз уровне так на 60-70, будучи одетым в лучше снаряжение из возможного, сражение превращается в долгий и изнурительный бой - марафон, по продолжительности сопоставимый с групповыми рейдами на мировых боссов в какой нибудь MMORPG 

К сожалению Slasher's Keep, не смотря на пеструю, действительно красивую обертку на деле оказывается игрой про превозмогания, духоту, однообразие и что самое паршивое - про уныние, а начинания с второго биома, ещё и про eбаные прыжки и тайминги. Чем дольше играешь Slasher's Keep, чем острее чувствуются её недостатки, абсолютно ужасный баланс и уeбанские игровые решения

Первой начинает сыпаться сама концепция арен, если в той же Dark Messiah, они были хорошо режиссированы и дополнялись смекалкой и фантазией игрока, то тут они генерируются случайно по ассетам, и не всегда эти генерации удачны

Локации тесные и часто перегруженные кучей препятствий и не разрушаемых объектов, что путаются под ногами и мешают движению как Вам, так и тупым болванчикам, что в них регулярно будут застревать

Частенько можно видеть, как какой нибудь моб завидев Вас включает все свои лошадиные силы и пытается добраться до Вас тараня какой нибудь стеллаж и большой кухонный стол в придачу, роняя с них всю стоящую кухонную утварь, медленно но верно толкая все эти вещи Вам на встречу

Или какой нибудь крот или зомби запутался в паутине и смотря на Вас жалобными глазами ожидают расправы над собой

К тому же у игры странное видение подвижности и возможности ГГ, герой может легко запрыгивать на ящики и на столы со стульями, но по не понятной причине не в состоянии перепрыгнуть перила, которые тут встречаются удивительно часто и тем самым срезают не мало мобильности и довольно часто могут оказаться причиной вашего окружения. Тем более что большую часть комнат - арен покинуть не выйдет, пока Вы победите всех врагов внутри

Не все гладко и с боевой системой, она простенькая, но в тоже время интересная, однако перестающая работать если Вам приходиться сражаться более чем с одни противником

Slasher's Keep так же пытается быть и рогаликом, но делает он это тоже не очень удачно

Тут Вам не интересных билдов, ни разнообразия, хоть враги и лут случайны, как и характеристики лута, по сути все сводиться лишь к набору по большей части мусорных статов и пассивных навыков от этажа к этажу, но какого либо опыта от уникального забега, потому как выпало особое оружие или уникальный предмет в корне меняющего геймплей тут нет и в помине

Арсенал холодного оружия, состоящий из 4 типов тоже разочаровывает. Из-за раздутости ХП врагов, использовать легкие атаки почти нет смысла в виду их нищего урона, а силовые атаки молотов и топоров заряжаются слишком медленно и в тесных помещениях, где происходит большая часть сражений не всегда получиться отступить для хорошего замаха, кинжалы быстры, однако их базовый урон сам по себе самый низкий в игре, поэтому единственный тип оружия который имеет смысл использовать - это мечи в виду их сбалансированности

Как в какой нибудь ARPG / RPG в игре так же присутствуют требования к характеристикам персонажа, так что если Бох рандома пошлет Вам хорошую броню или оружие, не факт что Вы сможете их использовать в виду недостаточной прокачки одной из трех представленных характеристик в игре. А новое, хорошее снаряжение имеет критически важное значение, потому как кривая сложности в игре аховая и остро ощущается с каждым новым этажом, поэтому жизненно важно обзавестись максимально лучшим снаряжением из возможного

Но что примечательно из-за общей уебанской концепции баланса, все требования к характеристикам сходят на нет, если Вы к примеру осилив игру решите сыграть на 30 этажном данжеоне, потому как в игре есть зелья перманентного буста характеристик, которые в стандартной компании дают от 1 до 3 единиц статов, а вот на 30-60 уровненном забеге сходят с ума как враги и другие параметры игры, бустя Вашего персонажа сразу 40 или даже 60 очков статов

Превращая прокачку в раздувание трупа игрового баланса

Впрочем уже начиная начиная с 4-ого этажа обычной компании, игра превращается в тот самый TES IV с почти не пробиваемыми врагами, которые в свою очередь наносят по Вашему персонажу весьма впечатляющий урон

В этот момент увы приходит осознание, что точеные пики и пропасти которые есть почти в каждой комнате, там присутствуют не для того чтобы Вам было весело на них сажать врагов, а скорее потому что использование окружения порой единственный способ этих врагов в принципе избавиться, так как силы оружия становиться просто недостаточно

Доходит до такого что оружие в руках начинает воспринимается скорее как палка - талисман, содержащая пассивные абилки для персонажа, нежели средство устранение врагов

Разумеется при таком раскладе не мудрено словить от здешних обитателей - ваншот, но не переживайте смерть в Slasher's Keep - это часть гринда и прогресса. Погибнув в бою Ваш персонаж отправиться обратно в свою камеру на первом этаже, с потерей всего надетого снаряжения и содержимого сумки, а так же с денежным пенальти, однако у Вас останется часть прокаченных статов и навыков

К тому же блуждая по коридорам Slasher's Keep Вы будете время от времени натыкаться на мусоропроводы и именно в них Вам следует скидывать оружие и броню которые Вы переросли, потому как все что Вы туда отправите, в последствии окажется внутри стартового сундука возле Вашей камеры

Таким образом, вероятность удачи Вашей следующей попытке зависит исключительно от Вашей запасливости и осмотрительности

Причем эта гринд концепция сохраняется даже в режиме с одной жизнью, с той лишь разницей, что рестарт будет происходить не в результате смерти (она приводит к окончательному проигрышу), а через специальные сброс - люки которые появляются только в хардкорном режиме

Однако эта игра не была бы настолько уeбанской, если бы мобов нужно было бы просто перерасти. Дело в том что в игре присутствует некий автолевелинг, который все равно будет подтягивать врагов немного вверх, поэтому подымаясь по башне во второй или даже третий раз, все равно можно встретить ощутимое сопротивление со стороны мобов

Если бы не этот гринд, стандартная компания пролеталась бы за час – полтора

В игре впрочем есть есть и положительные моменты 

В отличие от самого игрового процесса тут на удивление и хорошо сделаны два босса, которые побеждаются не очевидным способом

В игре ОЧЕНЬ крутая кузница позволяющая собрать диковинную вундервавлю с собственным дизайном

В игре большое разнообразие артов оружия и брони, а так же несколько рас разблокируемых при определенных условиях во время прохождении компании, а ещё тут можно ловить и есть тараканов, опарышей и даже пауков

В остальном Slasher's Keep скорее увы разочаровывает и не дарит никакого удовольствия от скитания по своим коридорам и сражениям с её обитателями, нет так же никакого фана от фарминга снаряги получше, при условии конечно, что Вы не начнете игру в EASY MODE, в нем все это есть

Однако разработчик не хочет чтобы Вы получали Фан, он хочет Вас душить, поэтому ачив и прочих наград за игру в этом режиме Вы не получите

И не смотря на положительные обзоры обратите просто внимание что ачиву I'm too young to die (за прохождение базовых 10 этажей) получило всего 11 % игроков

review: Amazing FPS rogue-lite/dungeon crawler with a fine-tuned combat system. Lots of great loot, perks and even crafting and alchemy. It can be pretty difficult at times but also feels very rewarding. Couple of interesting boss fights. Much deeper game than it says on the tin!

author: {'steamid': '76561198118510304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 656, 'last_played': 1710349603}

author: {'steamid': '76561197977146636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1673032418}
review:
Great dungeon crawler with tons of fun loot for a small price.
Fighting is a bit samey, still has its depth.
Loot is different like Diablo, with randomized stats and abilities.
You can craft your own weapons, you level up and keep abilities.
You can use melee or ranged, magic or tools like bombs.
Theres a save system in place and a way to pass items back to your next run, so theres a choice of which items you keep for your current run and which you drop down for the next.

There is an Easy Mode and a Permadeath Mode which deletes your character upon death.
You can find secrets and quests (however the quest sysem is super simplistic).

The visual style is good but thats ofcourse highly subjective.
Sure the game has smaller problems or maybe isnt as deep in some places as one might want, but its fun, its good, has plenty of content and unlockable characters, weapons etc and isnt too expensive for all of that.
If you want a fun Looter Shooter with dungeon crawling and randomization mixed with Dark Messiah combat, this is it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970487343', 'num_games_owned': 1123, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1673827177}

author: {'steamid': '76561198146456100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1672605713}
review:
''Dikkat çekici tarzı ile hoş dursa da, mekanik eksikleri aşırı fazla. Bu yüzden beni içine çekemedi. Rogue-like sevenler indirimde bir göz gezdirebilir.''

TEMEL DEĞERLENDİRME :
HİKAYE/ATMOSFER: Çok dandik bir arayüz ile ekrana 2D bir parşömen geldi, üstünde hikaye yazıyordu. Olayın saçmalığından okuyamadım bile. Atmosfer olarak bile değişik bir havası var, sevemedim. 3/10
DETAYLAR: Üstüne yürüdüğüm şeylerin devrilmesi hoş, ilk seferimde kapının devrilmesi hoşuma da gitmişti hatta. 6/10
GRAFİK: Cesaret isteyen bir tarz, ah bir de şu oyuna güzel bir mekanik çaksalarmış, tadından yiyemezdim. Yine tadından yiyemedim ama, bu sefer kötü olduğu için. 8/10
HATALAR: Dediğim gibi, mekanik eksikliği, onu saymazsam ufak parçalar duvara sıkıştı. 2/10
FİYATINI HAK ETME: Çok aşırı zengin değilseniz, elinize harcamalardan sonra para kalmıyorsa pas geçin. İndirimde 8tl, rogue-like sevenler sadece baksın derim.

Sonuç:
Evet, bağımsız yapımcı. Evet, destek olmak gerekir de, ama içine çekemeyen mekanik eksiği bir oyuna para yatırılmasını ben kendi ülkemin vatandaşı için istemem. Para kazanmak zaten zor iken, daha iyi yönde harcamasını isterim. Bu oyuna yapıcı eleştiri olması babında önermiyorum. Çok güzel bir potansiyele sahip, fakat bu mekanik sorunu çözülmeden çözülmez, çözülemeyecek.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065103259', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1672419994}

author: {'steamid': '76561197980887093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1671979559}
review:
Slasher's Keep is an interesting attempt at the first-person rogue-lite dungeon crawler experience, but it fails on several levels.
1) Movement. The character moves like molasses. There is a sprint key for forward movement, which is handy in particular situations, but backward movement is deliberately slowed to prevent you from back-stepping out of enemy melee attacks and so that you engage with the game's parry system. It's a poor method of requiring the system's use, as this could have allowed for something like dexterity to increase movement speed, allowing variety in playstyle. In addition, the character easily gets hung up on terrain, small stair lips, and so forth. This oversight led to several frustrating deaths which should not have occurred.
2) Combat. It's generally a left-click spam, then right-click directional parry to block or prevent damage. Attacking an enemy's face usually results in higher damage. It works fine up to level 2, assuming you have a reasonably decent weapon. However, combat becomes a slog by level 3 as you fight recycled enemies but with higher damage and health. Ranged combat with wands is utter garbage, as most wands have insanely slow projectiles and low damage output. In addition, wands require the use of certain potions to recharge them, thus taking up more precious inventory space.
3) Upgrades / level up. You have three stats - STR, DEX, INT - which are clearly marked with tooltips as to their effects. Simple, but serviceable. You'll gain a skill point for purchasing perks / skills each level as well, but which ones you have access to are provided by what equipment you've managed to pick up. If you've had poor luck then you will have either terrible or no skills. The skills that are available provide arguably useless abilities, like 7.1% chance to deal X fire damage, or an increase of 4.0% damage during a killstreak.
4) Death. Characters are persistent, but upon death you lose a portion of your levels, stats, gold, and any items in your inventory. There are chutes you can use to drop equipment for beefing later runs. Unfortunately, due to the tedious grind the game wishes you to perform, your best bet is always dumping the best gear you can find at a chute, going back and killing every monster, rinse and repeat ad nauseum.

It's not a bad title, just unpolished and lacking in variety. I picked it up on sale and I don't feel like I wasted my money, just that it could've been better. For the full asking price, however, I'd steer clear - the game needs some tuning and work to make it more than just mediocre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027560843', 'num_games_owned': 1048, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1671954964}
review:
Just can't get into it. Everything feels so stiff and janky. Constantly getting hooked up on the levels geometry, especially stairs during combat. Maybe things improve later on but with the short time I put in it really pushed 'Hard because hard games are "fun".'
The reviews are a lot of positive one and I'm sure it's deserved, but personally I cannot recommend it based in large part on the things I mentioned as for me movement controls is a large part of if i'm going to enjoy the game or not. It's not all the controls though as the inventory was fine, however the switching between ranged and melee weapons being bound to what they are was not helping with the movement issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000116925', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 21914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8669, 'last_played': 1703368877}
review:
While not a story-rich dungeon crawler, it defiantly scratches an itch for a hack-n-slash looter. A good first person rogue-lite. It's only downside is the parkor sections in the 2nd biome. They're not hard, They just don't fit the theme. Plus it slows down the game for no reward or reason. The 1st and 3rd biomes also have parkor sections but you don't notice at first. That's how well integrated they are. Graphics are great, and the retro, 2D, cell-shaded, animated mobs are a nice throw back to '90's FPS's.

Recommend you pick it up. A fun little game.

review:
This is a spectacular game you should consider playing if you've ever played Dark Messiah, Chivalry or any other assorted First Person Slasher title. The combat and movement aren't the most refined but what's available is extremely soulful and makes for a fun loop. That said, the difficulty spike on the second and third zones can make the game unplayable for a lot of people. I wish there was more abundance of items/crafting areas or at the least some minor balance/combat changes but what's offered is sufficient enough. 

Fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198107685748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 5367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 941, 'last_played': 1665509255}
review:
Edit: BE REALLY SURE YOU WANT TO BEAT THE GAME AND START A NEW GAME PLUS, BECAUSE IF YOU DO, YOU'LL PROBABLY RUIN THE GAME.

New game plus is IMPOSSIBLE. I'm the kind of person that like to break games that you can farm - "dark souls? ha! beat everyone like a child's game". 
But this, this don't make any sense! If you die in new game plus (and you will) There's NO WAY you'll be able to keep playing, because you'll never be able to keep up with the enemy progression! That sucks! I wish they would nerf this, but it seems they have no intention to do so.

Anyway, here's a review I made in simple times, when I tought I had found the roguelite of my dreams :'C

This is the roguelite I've been looking for so long: You fight your way through a dungeon, evolve, and get skills. If you die you return to the begining and lose the itens you didn't save and some of your status. 
But the good part is this: You don't loose the skills you upgraded! So you can FUCKING FARM! hahahaha 
I love this game. If you wanna try something similar, try Dungeons of Edera. 
It's in alpha yet, I think, but it has a complete main story and game+ and it's also very fun. You don't loose skills either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060470006', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1662852606}
review:
[b] Zatím nedokážu ohodnotit hru jako celek, ale moje dosavadní zkušenost je následující: [/b]

[h1] Úvod [/h1]
Musím se přiznat, že mi trvalo najít si k této hře cestu, avšak po několika strávených hodinách, ve kterých jsem pochopil, že budu umírat (HODNĚ), jsem zjistil spoustu věcí. Momentálně na tom nemám nahráno tolik, takže hodnotím 5 prvních levelů, ale už ty mi dokázaly, že tohle je úplně jiný rogue-lite, než na který jsem zvyklý.

[h1] First person a combat [/h1]
First person zde funguje ruku v ruce s combatem, ve kterém opravdu záleží, kam se zrovna díváte, když vykrýváte útok. Dále můžete při combatu ovládat i směr švihu, či jestli nemá další útok být výpad. Každá zbraň má pochopitelně jinou nabídku útoků (se sekerou se výpad dělá těžko), a tak přijdou momenty, kdy se budete muset rozhodnout, zda chcete rychlé švihání upřednostnit před drtivými údery obrovským kladivem. Mimo svou hlavní zbraň a kouzelnou hůlku, která funguje jako vaše zbraň na dálku, můžete použít i svůj inventář. Ano, prostě můžete toho šmejda před váma přetáhnout svým naplněným inventářem a poslat ho tak přímo do ostnaté zdi nebo dolů do propasti.

[h1] Nějaká ta pomoc vašemu budoucímu já [/h1]
Je zde mechanika, která vám dává možnost si nějaký ten gear "poslat" do dalšího runu v případě, že umřete, a protože určitě budete ze začátku umírat, dost to ulehčí další průchod. Samozřejmě nebudete do té šachty házet to, co zrovna používáte a je vaším hlavním vybavením (pokud tedy nemáte 1 % životů a nejste si 100% jistí, že ta obří divno-moucha vás sundá, už když se na vás podívá), ale nějaké ty věci, které se nevyplatí prodat a zároveň nejsou nějak náročné, co se požadavků na atributy a level týče, se vyplatí prostě do té šachty vašemu budoucímu já hodit.

[h1] Herní smyčka [/h1]
Zmiňuji tu smrt, ale neumíráte v pravém slova smyslu, spíše vás zajmou a vrátí vás do cely, ve které jste začínali. Sebere vám to pár bodů ze základních atribut, vezme vám to všechny perky, které jste se nenaučili permanentně a sníží vám to level – dostatečný trest, avšak ne tak obrovský krok zpátky, aby se herní smyčka stala bolestí a jen frustrujícím grindem.

[h1] Závěr [/h1]
Tohle všechno podtrhuje líbivé grafické zpracování, dungeon plný pastí, crafting vlastních zbraní, tajné místnosti a spousta dalšího, co jsem neměl zatím příležitost potkat. :)

review: Slasher's Keep is one of the most underrated, underplayed games on Steam I know of. It has a unique art-style, satisfying combat with more depth than most first person melee games, a good sense of humor, a simple but interesting storyline (for each character), various characters, interesting mechanics, good music, fun sounds, and overall a banger of a game that I can only heartilly recommend to others.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987263274', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1151, 'last_played': 1659921844}
review:
While the game is definitely stylish, and has some extremely good elements of game design to its name including the custom weapons, the parry riposte combat against enemies, and the generally visceral feeling of scoring heavy hits... it falls flat very fast once you're out of the first few floors.

Enemy variety leaves some room to be desired, you get very tired of seeing the same goblinoid fellows over and over again with different colored skin and faintly different patterns of combat. While you gradually increase the viability of your equipment, it is not remotely enough to outpace the dungeon's level of rapid damage increment, enemies in later floors will be 3-4 shotting you even with a very well put together set of equipment that you spent time collecting, and your weapons start to feel like they're doing chip damage against enemies which you had been effortlessly decapitating one floor ago.

There is a major problem with progression, in that the game progresses too fast, and you will rapidly find yourself falling behind the times. This is, in my estimation, due to the way you are defeated (off permadeath mode), in that you retain some skills you had obtained through your previous run, as well as some of your stats, and whatever equipment you managed to spirit away on the above floors. This isn't necessarily a bad thing, as the initial floors do not tend to out-pace your combat effectiveness, but it is extremely dull. Additionally, enemy combat AI is very beeline oriented, and the cluttered, clumsy, procedurally generated arenas in which you find yourself, make for annoying combat encounters as you find yourself bumping into shin-high boxes which slow you to a crawl as you attempt to reposition around deadlier and deadlier enemies. The result is combat that wants you to think methodically about your plan of attack, but ambushes you with clutter around your feet and face, along with extremely potent traps that seem to violate hitboxes with reckless abandon. Your run can end very quickly at the hands of a goblin with a sword who cheap shots you as you attempt to clamber away, stymied by an inexplicably heavy, yet tiny box, or struck by a deadly energy ball that clipped through the terrain to slap you as you dove for cover.

To exacerbate issues, going through the initial floors is nothing but a chore, and while the menu, final boss, and first floor start with excellent music, the rest of the game is very low key, or ill-fitting in terms of music, to the point where you question where it has gone. This, coupled with the frustrating and grindy gameplay loop, makes for a bothersome experience that stops you very quickly in your tracks as you get the ball rolling, and tells you to hand over a large portion of your progress so you can go back to the beginning and experience power again, before the game repeats itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198983265727', 'num_games_owned': 82, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 3948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1708281365}

author: {'steamid': '76561198117513873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1659137031}
review:
First of all this game looks great, the art style is impeccable and reminiscent of the old late 90s games I used to play, so much so that I spent hours looking online for this game after I saw a few minutes of gameplay months ago.

Unfortunately, after playing for a bit, I can't really recommend it. Maybe it's just me, but I was expecting something a little faster paced, with a stronger RPG feel to it, but as it is, It vaguely reminds me of a dumbed down dark souls experience. The gameplay is sluggish and punishing, the build variety is disappointing, and the UI seems to be missing a couple of modern quality of life features, such as item comparisons and quickslots for consumables.

All in all, buy this only if you are looking for a slow, tactical and punishing dungeon crawler.
