author: {'steamid': '76561198009450052', 'num_games_owned': 1883, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 1908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1610173388}
review:
Tenía 15 minutos libres y me puse a ver de qué iba este juego: pasaron 4 horas desde que me senté

Hacía rato que no me atrapaba tanto un juego de este estilo, no tengo críticas fuertes, así bien hay bugs, no hay nada que te distraiga de tu objetivo, de avanzar avanzar avanzar. Querés craftear? podés! Querés entrar a una mazmorra? podes! Tenes ganas de encontrar formas ingeniosas para matar monstruos? podés! Te gustan los desafíos que no te sacan las ganas de jugar? este juego te da eso! 

El juego tiene esta estructura:
1. Comenzás la partida
2. Avanzas hasta donde podés
3. Juntás items y leveleas al personaje
4. Tratás de enviar items para tu próxima partida (una mecánica hermosa que te obliga a pensar a futuro)
5. Morís y sos penalizado
6. Comenzás la partida nueva utilizando lo que pudiste salvar

Esto no te asegura un avance constante, pero sí te pone ante una curva de dificultad que depende mucho de las elecciones y del tipo de juego que haga el jugador.

En pocas palabras: es un juego hermoso que recompensa el esfuerzo, y que no busca frustrarte para nada, cada partida es un aprendizaje que suma para la siguiente

10/10 Estigios

review: Looks like a very fun game and I am sure that the actual game is great. However, the game is cooking my cpu at some of the lowest settings. I personally am super anal about my computer temps, so this could just be a personal problem for me. However, I feel like people should understand that this came is not optimized well at all and will strain your hardware way more than you think it will. Maxes out GPU use and pushed my cpu temp to 87 degrees celcius will running on 1280X720 resolution and low preset. The game is not optimized well all, as my computer can run triple A games without breaking a sweat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120509225', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1606658834}
review:
I saw NL's showcase video and thought hey this looks kinda neat!
5 hours later and I don't know where this time has gone. 
This is a great, addictive game in the most simple way of saying possible.

It's a grind, but it's never tedious.
It can be challenging, but it's never frustrating.

The rogue like elements keep the gameplay refreshing and the crafting system is pretty cool. It's really neat to create a custom weapon and see it EXACTLY how you created it reflected in the game play. This is the most excited I've been for an indie release for a very long time and I look forward to see
how it develops over time. 

I'm feeling a strong 8 to a decent 9 on this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980389987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1654924216}
review:
The physics are abominable and enemies glitch into walls, otherwise, I love it.  I've only made it to floor 6 and I'm starting to toy with build min-maxing, which would be easier if there were a wikia page, but it's still fun.

My one gameplay gripe is the xp multiplier which forces you to kill fast and penalizes you for looting.  It means that to play optimally you should kill everything in a frenzied rampage, then go back and slowly loot the entire empty floor.  I'm starting to ignore looting altogether on my reruns of earlier floors and I'm enjoying it a lot more, although I wish the game blended slashing and looting more seamlessly.  Tedium bad.

The progression can feel frustrating at times but once you start to grasp the game's mechanics and all of the tools available to you it really opens up into an addictive and fun dungeon crawler.  The art style rules, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062147419', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1607659532}
review:
Game is actually really fun. Their is a very fun progression in the game, when you die, you lose your equipment and some levels and items. But every run you're a bit stronger from Perma-learning skills, and putting a lot of stat points in over time. There is some pretty crazy skills and seemingly game-breaking things you can do if you're patient enough. I love it.

Feels like an old school dungeon crawl, but with a diablo 2 kind of feel to the items. It's a lot like The Binding of Isaac in a lot ways where you progressively get stronger and stronger and your builds can vary wildly in any one run. In Binding of Isaac, you unlock new items and challenges. In this game, you slowly build up what kind of build you think you would like. It's awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198377042792', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1608511243}
review:
Fun game, but already experienced 2 game-breaking bugs: 
1. only exit to dungeon was behind jammed cell door (i used a map and revealed the whole floor, scoured the level for 30 mins and was unable to proceed) 
2. Silver key to door was missing on the level. I killed every enemy, ran around the level for an hour, even reloaded the game and rechecked every corpse on the floor to no avail, even after exposing the whole floor via a map. 

The game has great promise but I can't continue playing it because I have seen my efforts go up in smoke door to lack of polish. I don't know how the developer differentiates between "early access" and "finished", but this game is certainly unfinished. 

Also, many small items on the ground (barrel lids an inch off the ground, disembodied heads, etc.) will completely block you from moving forward and occasionally items such as bookcases will get stuck in doorways. 

The looting is excellent, but the game itself is unpolished and I really hope it gets more updates, especially with regards to the game-breaking bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990098162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 898, 'last_played': 1606098396}
review:
A great game that keeps me hooked for hours.  loving the way you get stronger the more you die and indeed have to die in order to gain the strength to move on :D

the ability score lose for death is easily regained and advanced upon with each play session, and the hunt for items to unlock skills to purchase is a nice little touch.

But the Crafting system  and item chutes are where it is.  you can build a god weapon and post it back to yourself when you feel you have progressed to your current level limits.  so when you die the items will be at the starting chest ready for your next run :)

a solid game worth every penny :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198012639182', 'num_games_owned': 603, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1606844899}
review:
it is a fun game at first, great concept and i am struggling with deciding whether or not to recommend the game.  I would say its possibly worth the money depending on your taste in games.  but unless the developer smooths over some of the edges i don't recommend it, yet.  I would expect on average for people to sink in around 5-10 hours of gameplay before all the little physics and hitbox annoyances make you lose interest. based on the gameplay i have experienced (up to floor 5 out of 10) i would give it a 70/100.  The concept is great, visually unique, it has depth and variety but it also feels  a bit janky and the gameplay gets repetitive. Basically its a good game that doesn't quite have the flawless feeling, endless fun factor that top tier roguelikes (isaac, risk of rain, ftl, rogue legacy, spelunky, slay the spire) have.  If this game gets regular updates and or the dev makes changes based on community feedback i think it has quite the potential to be killer.

Pros: 

   - Art style - very unique, original feel

   - depth/variety - so far, a decent amount of enemies, weapons/armor, trinkets and map variety.  Tons of unique skills you can inherit on your character allowing for different play styles

   - weapon customization - fun feature where you can collect different weapon parts and create your own weapon with unique stats and skills based on the parts you use.  you can also "build" the weapon, moving around and rotating the parts you use to make the weapon look as badass or as funny looking as you want

   - Combat - combat feels pretty smooth, is easy to pick up and has a good amount of variety to it

   - character leveling/skill progression - as you level up you add points to attributes, to increase your stats, and you gain skill points to permanently inherit skills from unique weapons or armor and upgrade the skills once permanent.  

Death/respawn - when you die you keep most of the character levels, attributes and gold (i would say you lose around 20% of both upon death), not enough for it to not feel like you are losing everything and just starting all over (see cons for the negative side to this).  the game also has a chute feature where you can send any inventory item (consumable, weapon, armor,  trinket) back to the start for you to use from the start when you die, allowing you to semi-breeze through the first few floors.


Cons: 

 - janky movement/ enviornment -  controls are fine, but movement over and around objects feels off and you get stuck on things that you should be able to walk over (exploded barrel parts).  Along with this, there are destructible and movable objects, potion crates and explosive barrels can be broken/destroyed and yet regular crates and barrels are indestructible, only able to be pushed around, get in your way and falling in front of doorways (stupid shelves).  it feels like everything movable should also be destructible, otherwise rooms and areas just feel (and are) too cluttered.  

 - Wands seem way under powered - not much to explain here but i have almost never used my wands, except to see what they do.  and when i do use them it usually ends with me taking more damage than i would have, had i just kept my melee weapon out.  It may have to do with the limited capacity to shots, but also just the damage seems so weak in comparison to a melee weapon.

   - Item stacking on ground - When you say open a crate or kill an enemy that drops multiple items, everything stacks on top of each other, often glitching inside of the open chest/ dead body and it is nearly impossible to hover over/ move around and see the items on the ground, meaning you have to either pick it all up and drop what you don't want, or if your inventory is full, drops items out of your inventory, pick up items from the ground, look at the stats, keep/ drop items you want, then pick up the items you dropped (i don't mind having to do inventory management, its more just the fact that i have to do it just to see the items).  

   - Hitboxes - it may be due to the 2d/3d fusion paper mario-like art style but the hitboxes of objects and enemies feel off.  sometimes for example it takes me like 6 swings to finally make contact with, and break open a pot if my character is not literally humping the pot.  when it comes to enemies, depending on the angle you are trying to hit them at, you can pretty easily whiff an attack that looks like a spot on hit (usually due to stairs, items, other enemies or camera movement)

   - minimap - I feel like the map is too small, making it hard to see where the key points are and where i want to go.  i feel like the minimap should be more zoomed in and have a large map you can open up to.  Also just something about the style of the minimap makes it hard to see where exactly the doors are in relation to the walls/rooms (hard to explain, might just be me)

- Parkour map post floor 4 - There are around 40  perfectly timed jumps in a row and you have about 2 seconds in between jumps to make the next jump.  In concept this is not that hard, and it is passable once you try enough, but due to the physics and lack of a jump that give you really any vertical, you often get slowed by a wall or have your jump input eaten, causing you to fall all the way back to the start.  For me, this section really is just a nuisance and frustrates me when i get there.  Although i will say at least for the first 10 floors i believe this only shows up twice, which is not as bad as i had initially thought.  (from other reviews it seemed like every level after that would just be riddled with these types of puzzles) 

   - Repetitive - (Edited) The difficulty scaling at first is very high, and requires a lot of trial and error and frustrating losses, but as you progress and become more confident with each floor, there is less and less resetting needed to get further.

   - Losing progress -  when you die you lose everything (item-wise) you did not stash away in the chute.  Because of this you need to farm and stash away second set of items in case you die.  this seems fine, except for when you are trying to strengthen you character by resetting runs aka stashing all your best items and restarting to get more gold and consumables/ weapon parts in order to be strong enough to progress.  If you accidentally die while doing this, you lose every item you have and almost all of that progress is lost, all of the gold you spent on top of the line equipment is gone,  and depending on how much you were grinding, you lose ALOT of time/progress.  I accidentally fell off the edge while looking at the minimap, speeding through the beginning few floors after resetting about 8 times in order to prepare myself and get good armor and weapons for the big boss and it felt like i lost hours worth of item progression. (small kind-of niche con but thought i would mention it because it bugged me)

author: {'steamid': '76561198072632516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 5702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1607029570}

author: {'steamid': '76561198321738054', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1606525413}
review:
Slasher's Keep is a great game with interesting combat that really makes you think. The art style is fantastic and really helps with the atmosphere. The game has a perfect difficulty (for me at least) and forces you to learn attack patterns and bosses weaknesses (Spider Boss on floor 4 for example (needs 3 bombs to kill)).

I do have a few things that I think could be better or could be changed
1. Make intelligence and dexterity more useful (not just being used to equip equipment) They could do this by having dexterity make you run faster and intelligence making your wands more powerful.
2. I think the game needs more enemies to spice things up. 
3. More outposts like shops and smithies.
4. Make the skills more potent and actually change the way you play instead of just being a flat update. This would need a rework, but I think they could do it by say only allowing you to bringing 3 skills and then that can be upgraded by using three skill points on having more skills able to be used instead of upgrading skills.

Overall, I think slashers keep is a great game, but it could use some polishing and changes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042320357', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1697334102}
review:
Extremely compelling combat so far, the game is charming, it doesn't rush you and it gives you a lot of different methods to approach tackling each room. It isn't your typical rouge-lite 'kill every enemy in this room or you die,' it gives you options, you can kill half the room and move on until later, you can use bombs, spikes, clubs or even shotgun-like wands to defeat the monsters. The game has a semi-permanent upgrade system combined with the ability to get upgrades on each run although so far the game has been quite forgiving as when I die I lose a fraction of what I upgraded. 

TLDR: Great combat, extremely charming and hopefully will have a lot of potential and replayability. .

author: {'steamid': '76561198011668467', 'num_games_owned': 840, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1672441067}
review:
Games amazing. Watched NorthernLion play it looked interesting. Bought it and played it all evening. Very entertaining gameplay. The randomness needs work though, some airborn enemies won't come to you and if you can't reach them, you cant get out of the room, some enemies will get stuck in the wall and again you can't get out of the room.

Little things like this needs work but the combat is very good and the mechanics are tight.

Couple more hours, still good. I also found out that if your in a room for too long the doors will open, to let you carry on. So it's annoying but they know the issue and are trying to fix it.

review:
>Be a badass warrior
>Plow through two levels of the dungeon with ease, hit up the vendor and get tons of parts to smith a new weapon
>Lucky! Third level of the dungeon has a smithy this time
>Build "Sev's Murderwacker", legendary custom axe with lifestyle, fire, and intelligence boosts
>Decide to test it out on a low-risk mob, see how good it murders/wacks
>Start swinging at him, damage is great and he catches on fire
>Don't realize I'm on top of an oil slick
>Oil catches fire, had no clue that was even possible
>Kills me instantly

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198003553024', 'num_games_owned': 658, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1616023895}
review:
It sure as hell ain't perfect, but its a good deal of fun. First off this game is closer in feel to something like Void Bastards than a traditional rogue-like or dungeon crawler. There's a bit of humor to be found, but don't expect to be hit over the head by it unless it happens to be that orc holding a cleaver. It's a slow, and very simple game, with the majority of the action to be found in directional parries and sack tapping enemies into pits and trap like something from Dark Messiah: Might and Magic. There's plenty of loot to be found and a crafting system to be had, although I haven't had a chance to dabble in it myself. There's perks that you can learn from equipment like Path of Exile, with the ability to assign points and make them a permanent part of your build, along with RPG stat point standards.

Bottom line you like the spirit and pace of old dungeon crawlers with the look and feel of something more modern like Void Bastards then pick it up, its worth the low price. If you're more of a Binding of Isaac or Enter the Gungeon fan then probably stay away. It's a game that borrows from many sources making it a bit of an odd gumbo of gaming past and present. I for one enjoy it though, weird quirks and all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284276176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1667883851}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993862489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 8577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1635716971}
review:
I love the mechanics in this game. The parry system, crafting, sack throwing, they're all fun. Plus having some of your stats carry over into subsequent runs (when not in permadeath) and using the chute to send your next life good items to start with really serves the game well. I've only just cracked the surface but I'm really eager to dive in deeper. Inventory can be a slight pain when you have like 6 items on the ground in a stack and are trying to get one out, but that's my only real gripe at this time.

This is instantly my favorite first person roguelike.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998626572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1607198662}
review:
Played it for 4 hrs, and am requesting a refund. 

The game starts off well enough. The graphics and music are pretty decent, and charming, in a retro sort of way. 

The combat, while nothing special, works pretty well. The melee, in particular. The AI is pretty dumb, but that might be a good thing, as we'll discuss in a second.

The game starts off easy enough. You find consumables that refresh health. You have ways of using the environment against the many enemies you'll encounter, which makes up - to some degree - for the fact that your weapons are fairly underpowered compared to the amount of damage the enemy deals.

Around level 4 or so, however, the game gets very hectic. Enemies start doing [i]ridiculous[/i] amounts of damage, and equipment become obsolete very quickly. I honestly don't know how people survive. Seems to involve a lot more luck that skill, most of the time. Good thing the enemies are dumb as heII, because I can't imagine how we'd get through them otherwise.

The reason why I'm requesting a refund, however, is the jump puzzles. Around level 4, you start encountering them, and they just suck the fun out of the experience for me. Have me figure out how to use the environment against a mob, by all means. But having to perform 20+ perfect jumps, in sequence, to get to the top of a tower, and get a key, when the character seems to handle like he's drunk, is not worth my time.

Around the 15th time I was trying the same puzzle I realized that I was no longer having fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969419160', 'num_games_owned': 669, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1689643637}
review:
I made the measured decision to drop my entire amazing loadout into the chute before dying to the first real boss ([spoiler] you know, the giant spider [/spoiler]). We're talking no weapon and running around in my skivvies. That was the plan though, so it was an expected and welcomed death to set myself up for great progress on the next one.

When I respawn, I'm immediately OP due to my equipment level because of the genius planning. First room I get to with mosquitos in it, I sprint around like mad man to kill them all. One left. I do an incredible flying leap with a charged up attack to snag one out of the air. It was a trap. The mosquito was hovering over a giant bottomless pit hidden in the corner. I fall. I die. I lose my incredible loot. I rage quit.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198048559993', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1641426624}
review:
3 hours of game play in!

For 10 bucks and the amount of enjoyment I get for money, it is money well spent! It's a randomly generated dungeon crawler with a lot to learn. Controls can be a little bit clunky, but i got better as I went. I love the DOOM original style look that this game gives off! Gave me a major nostalgia boner the whole time playing. Going to definitely jump into this game again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198061548222', 'num_games_owned': 1090, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1616884413}
review:
[h1] I also made a longer, more in-depth video review here:
https://youtu.be/z2_rxNnbjpM [/h1]

Slasher’s Keep is a roguelite that plays unlike any other roguelite I have ever played and it has an extremely unique art style and overall feel.

The most obvious thing to mention with this game is it's presentation and artstyle. The game takes place in a 3D world but all the enemies and the loot you find in the game are 2D. 

So they do that you thing that you may have seen in other games do where the 2D sprites rotate to always match your perspective. And this gives the game a kind of unsettling vibe, at least to me because it makes it seem like every single enemy in the game is always watching you.

And so you start in a dungeon and you open a chest at the beginning of every run that will give you like 2-3 random items normally like some armor or accessories and a weapon.

You will be finding a lot of different loot so there is a lot of attention on the inventory system. You have a bag that can hold a certain amount of items by size and every item you find takes up a different amount of space and you can equip any items you have on your character. 

And one thing I really like about this system beyond it just being very streamlined and easy to understand is that if you mouse over an item like a helmet when you already have a helmet it will show you very easily if it is better or worse in various different stats so you don't have to get out a calculator to figure things out.

From there you than go from room to room killing enemies, finding new loot, leveling up, and trying to find the exit point to climb one stage higher in the dungeon to escape.

And the combat in the game is a little more rigid than you might encounter in other FPS roguelites but that isn’t necessarily a bad thing and I’ll explain.

So for every weapon you can swing it normally, you can charge attack in three different ways by holding different directions, and you can parry enemy attacks. So as enemies see you they will start coming to you to fight you and because the models are pretty much these 2D sprites they have to get really to close to you. 

So a lot of times you start getting overwhelmed by several enemies just getting right up in your face. And a lot of the enemies take a lot of hits in order to die. So in order to not get completely overwhelmed. You can actually hit enemies with your inventory sack knocking them back a little. 

And so the combat is a little more about timing your attacks and blocking the enemies and overall just very spacing focus. You can’t let the enemies start overwhelming you right up in your face because otherwise it gets extremely hard to hurt them without taking damage.

Also the game knows it’s not this crazy action packed game and so the rooms you fight sometimes contain traps like spikes that you can hit enemies into instantly killing them or pit you can knock them into.

You also have wands which are the other major way you can deal damage. There are special ones but the one you will see the most is something that shoots these slow projectiles at enemies. And they all have a limited amount of ammo and will break when they run out. So you can’t use these too much because ammo is so limited and that is one of my minor complaints with the game of what I have played so far.

The other huge part about this game is it has a leveling up system very similar to an RPG. So when you get enough experience to level up you instantly get all your health back, you get a couple skill points, and sometimes new abilities. 

The game is definitely on the challenging side. I have played for a couple of hours in order to get a general feel of the game to make a review but I know for a fact that there is so much in this game I haven’t even scratched the surface of. So it’s definitely the type of game that you could play for countless hours to master and discover everything it has to offer.

So overall I would definitely recommend Slasher’s Keep to fans of FPS roguelites as long as you know it is a little less action packed in terms of high octane combat and more fleshed out in RPG elements like the inventory and character development side of things. Also if anything you should definitely get the game just to experience the really interesting style of the 2Dish sprites in the 3D world as it is really awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960577210', 'num_games_owned': 1681, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1605976632}

author: {'steamid': '76561198069513316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 2393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1606495358}
review:
It's a fun little dungeon crawler with a nice art style and reasonable progression curve, but I don't think it was quite ready for launch.
As there are still some issues with it, some of them minor, some of them major.

Minor being issues with the controller, it's impossible to quick swap away from a broken wand with the B button. Avoid able with the right skills or setting the hot swap bar, but still irritating.
Lack of any tutorial or explanation for setting up the Y button or Hotbar, again not rocket science but irksome.
The speech volume is way too low and leaves the few speaking characters, mumbling gibberish to themselves.

The major one (that I have encountered) is with level generation.
It's still possible for the code to generate a map with no way of getting through, beyond killing yourself and losing everything.
This, is super frustrating when it happens on dungeon level 1 and thus you have literally lost all the gear you've been hoarding from higher levels.

But, it's still a good game and definitely worth your time, with luck these issues will be ironed out fairly quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992242719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1706105586}
review:
This thing is a grind. A huge grind. And that's good. I originally bought this for its aesthetic and then refunded it because it was so grindy. Then I reconsidered and repurchased it because in retrospect it was just what I wanted.

So a couple of points. 

First off, the aesthetic. If you've ever played Daggerfall Unity you know exactly what to expect (if you haven't, check it out, it's a blast). The characters are emphatically not 3D and everything looks hand painted. It makes for a charming, low key, and slightly goofy experience, especially once the blood (of which there are buckets) starts to splatter. The weapons range from silly to badass to ridiculous. Want a club made from bananas tied to a stick? A prehistoric stone ax? A classical xiphos? They're all there. Armors are the same: everything from fur to fop. There are even great decorations: come for the endless dungeon crawling, stay for the slightly disturbing orc pinups. 

Moving on to UI. It's a tad frustrating, to be honest. The keymapping, for example, is not intuitive and fixed. Want to draw your weapon by clicking the mouse? Too bad, press x. Your inventory is likewise fixed and cannot be upgraded, although this is part of another rather clever mechanic I'll get to later. Fortunately, everything is simple and easy to learn, so slightly frustrating is as far as it ever goes, 

Mechanics. This one is tough. Part of me things they're pure genius, the other wants to strangle the devious dev who made the decisions. There is no pause, but there is a save spot on every floor. The floors are small, but random and packed with baddies. Stores exist, but good luck finding one when you need it. You lose everything when you die unless you've deliberately sacrificed something to an item chute for your next run (truly, if you love something you must learn to set it free). The crafting system is clever, but in five hours I've found TWO smithies. And my personal least favorite, you lose levels and skill every time you die. Which you will. A lot. This makes the grind feel endless, but you learn, and you get better, and the game rewards you with learned perks that can't be lost. 

This doesn't mean it's all frustration and no payoff. Remember that size-locked inventory? That's because it's actually a bag you carry in your offhand and can beat monsters with for knockback, preferably into one of the VERY generously distributed spike traps. Oh, and spiking any monster is one-shot. Satisfying. There are no shields, but you can parry, and I don't mean just pressing a button: you have to actually block the swing. It makes combat more entertaining and less mindless. Ranged combat is by means of disposable wands that act like everything from pistols to shotguns and mortars. 

To make a long review short, Slasher's Keep is a dungeon-crawling roguelite created by someone who obviously loves the genre. It takes a simple format and uses its mechanics to force the player to make choices that can frustrate, but also create an atmosphere and experience that both enhances replayability and extends enjoyment. And the cherry on top is that it's all wrapped in an aesthetic and art style that says "it's okay to just goof around, kill stuff, and laugh at the posters on the walls. Go ahead, bash the slightly befuddled looking wizard into the spike pole: that's what it's there for. Besides, he deserved it."

author: {'steamid': '76561198148649068', 'num_games_owned': 583, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1680868052}
review:
TLDR: play Delver https://store.steampowered.com/app/249630/Delver/

This game is not ready for a release, its probably not even ready for early access. Issues with the UI, with the physics, with animations.
This isn't a bad idea for a game they just loaded it down with poor decisions, or simply a lack of talent.
The dungeon lacks any kind of atmosphere. I think its supposed to be going for wacky, but beyond like two or three funny things the majority of the environment lacks any kind of character, not helped by the strange, mannequin bodies and sad attempts at animations.
Melee combat is so stiff and unintuitive that I'm willing to believe that your meant to slowly switch over to ranged weapons as you progress through the game, but I wouldn't know.
There are two interesting ideas; to block you hold down M2 and hold your guarding weapon in the direction that an enemy is attacking from. Now with this in mind the weird animations could be forgiven to a point. The problem is that you can't block every character's attacks and if you cant block their attacks your just going to take damage because you move so slow and awkwardly. Also hitting the flying enemies with melee weapons is infuriating. The second okay idea is that you can smack people with your loot sack, which is genuinely funny and unique, mechanics wise it knocks enemies back and you can knock enemies into spikes or off the map. The problem with this is that it doesn't knock them back far enough nor does it recharge fast enough. This is probably how your meant to avoid unblockable attacks but the timing is off.
There's a lot they could have done here. Add a dash mechanic. Hire an actual animator. Work on world design. Fix the doors so they don't always swing open in the most inconvenient direction, and tons more but honestly it may not be worth it. Its a cheap game and was probably one of the dev's first projects and I'm sure it was some good experience for them. But I just cant recommend this, in fact I can't even believe how anyone could recommend the game. Its not just bad its unfinished.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961635953', 'num_games_owned': 1093, 'num_reviews': 230, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1607424381}
review:
[h1]Polished Early Access[/h1]
Slasher's Keep is a mostly fun & addictive rogue-lite game that suffers from A LOT of bad ideas. Feels like a combination of Arx Fatalis with the combat from Elder Scrolls: Oblivion.

[b]Pros:[/b]
[list][*]Great art style and presentation.
[*]Addictive gameplay.[/list]
[b]Cons, Cons & More Cons:[/b]
[list]
[*]Platforming.
[*]Horribly balanced difficulty scaling as you progress.
[*]Clunky combat controls with borderline input delay.
[*]Wands break when they run out of ammo. Why?
[*]Smithing weapons is almost a useless mechanic.
[*]Can't modify or even check key bindings in the menu.
[*]Trap rooms.
[*]You lose levelled up stats every time you die.
[*]Atrocious hit detection during combat.
[*]You can't even pause the game. Pressing ESC doesn't stop the gameplay.
[*]Runs plagued with literally broken rooms, causing entire restart and loss of all your loot.
[*]Did I mention platforming?[/list] 
I still give it a thumbs up though, because I think the core idea is good and over time I hope this stuff will be fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196756273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1700369506}
review:
Muito bom. 

Jogo me surpreendeu de maneira muito positiva. ;D

Se você está procurando um dungeon crawler com muitos elementos de RPG e consegue aproveitar um conceito de visual diferente, pronto. Já está valendo. 

Além do modo normal com respawn no andar inical e algumas punições de morte, sua run pode ser um passeio no bosque com modo Easy Mode, ou pode ser intensa com modo Permadeath.

Tudo randomizado, loots deliciosos que aparecem quando você equipa e tudo mais. O/

We go agane, boys. Gogogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003867532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1654724321}
review:
This game really outdoes itself in the combat department. Directional blocking in a rogue-like old school dungeon crawler ! Game is split into 10 levels, with death meaning you fall back to level 1. You also lose the vast majority of items (Unless you dropped a few down the garbage shoot for the next run) and your levels/stats deteriorate. Lots of fun weapons to find and loot, or craft if you're lucky enough to have found a forge and the components in a single run !  

Pros 
- Combat way above indie game level. I wish more games learn from this game.
- Lots of loooooooooooooooot
- Mix of cute cartoon like environment and cute sprites with face meltingly punishing perma-death

Cons 
- Severed heads from enemies tripped me over and I died.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081111924', 'num_games_owned': 838, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1700790350}
review:
Игра неплохая. Несмотря на интересный визуальный стиль рисовка врагов мне показалась уж слишком примитивной, это немного расстраивает. Боёвка не сказать что очень увлекательна, но сказал бы, что отзыв по ней скорее нейтральный. Что мне понравилось, так общая атмосфера игры - здесь нет тотального хардкора и начала каждый раз с нуля (после смерти характеристики лишь немного теряются, золото тоже + с более высоких этажей вы сможете сбросить себе в первую камеру сильные предметы) - как следствие, игра вместо атмосферы сурового хардкорного приключения имеет окрас скорее приятной ненапряжной истории, где можно поискать тайнички, покачать героя, потолкать врагов на ловушки и т.д. В каждом аспекте есть более достойные игры, но если смотреть на игру в комплексе - мне кажется, что она очень даже может подарить достаточное количество фана. 
Если захотите глянуть ролик по игре (не обзор, но и не сырое видео с тыканьем в каждую стену): https://youtu.be/TdRZ0FgA-0c

author: {'steamid': '76561198270975555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 156, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1711418160}
review:
Slasher´s Keep foi um dos melhores jogos de RPG rogue que já joguei, um jogo viciante e divertido com muito potencial a se explorar, nesse comentário que está lendo, irei apontar tudo que precisa saber sobre essa obra de arte:

Este jogo se baseia em um sistema onde, nós aventureiros estamos em uma masmorra e temos que enfrentar diversos inimigos enquanto saqueamos a masmorra, melhoramos nosso arsenal de armas e armaduras... E também subimos de nível para evoluir nossos atributos que são força, inteligencia e destreza. 

Quanto mais progredimos no jogo, mais desafiador fica, você pode escolher entre se morrer perde tudo incluindo o personagem ou modo normal, onde mesmo se morrer, você volta do inicio, mas mantem o personagem e algumas caracteristicas e atributos dele.

Falado isso, vamos para os pontos positivos, negativos e que podem ser melhorados neste jogo:

Pontos positivos:

1- Seus gráficos são muito bem trabalhados e desenhados.

2- Ótimo desafio dentro do jogo, até o modo fácil se torna desafiador.

3- Progressão longa, ainda não joguei o suficiente para saber se a progressão é infinita, mas aparentemente é.

4- Uma boa variedade de itens, armas e armaduras com variaveis status disponiveis ao longo do jogo.

5- Em niveis mais avançandos de masmorras, tem até puzzles para resolver ou armadilhas mais desafiadoras que exigem paciencia e agilidade para as resolver.

Pontos negativos:

1- De vez em nunca, alguns inimigos teleportam enquanto atacam, não interfere tanto na gameplay e nem deixa o jogo injogavel, apenas deixa alguns inimigos mais dificeis de se matar graças a esse bug.

2- Muita pouca variedade de escolhas e opções para criação de caracteristicas de personagens, tendo só disponivel algumas opções, mesmo as desbloqueaveis são poucas.

3- No forjamento de armas, onde criamos armas, a criação das armas está um pouco bugado, fazendo com que geralmente as armas tenham aparências bem feias ou estranhas, com peças em locais que não deveriam estar.

Pontos que ainda podem ser melhorados ou adicionados ao jogo que fariam esse jogo ser ainda melhor:

1- Modo multiplayer e cooperativo entre amigos adicionado. (Sério, faz isso e o jogo bomba!).

2- Mais variação de customização de personagens.

3- Arrumar a criação de armas e disponibilizar também mais formas de custumizar a arma, como mudar sua cor, adicionar mais enfeites e coisa do tipo.

4- O bloqueio do jogo é um pouco dificil de se entender e usar com precisão, talvez uma melhoria no sistema de defesa ajudaria.

5- Poder explorar melhor as armas nesse jogo seria muito interessante, como usar 2 facas(uma em cada mão), poder usar cajados, escudos, arco e flechas e outros tipos de armas, pois por enquanto, só é possivel usar varinhas mágicas, machados, facas, porretes e espadas, e não pode usar duas armas ao mesmo tempo.

Acho que por enquanto, esses são todos os pontos que eu gostaria de apontar, o jogo em si é incrivel, viciante, bonito e com um super potencial! Vale MUITO apena os 20 reais, espero que coloquem um modo multiplayer neste jogo, pois eu gostaria muito de jogar com os meus amigos isso.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993312995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 801, 'last_played': 1668194104}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009800914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1605894776}
review:
Review edited based on patch released today 28/11/2020:

BUYER BEWARE - This game has/had lethal bugs. Rooms trap you in until you've killed all the enemies. On my second run I was trapped in a room with an enemy that had spawned inside the wall, resulting in a forced restart. This is lethal for a roguelike. Do not buy until developer gives a guarantee in the description that wall spawning bugs have been completely dealt with. I'm just glad this happened while I could still request a refund.

EDIT: Patch 1.02 states that wall spawns have been addressed. Purchase at your discretion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065811361', 'num_games_owned': 1070, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 993, 'last_played': 1606338911}

author: {'steamid': '76561198166833342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1605824455}
review:
I movimenti del personaggio sono a dir poco legnosi; oltretutto il salto non ti permette di saltare le staccionate che sono sparse in tutte le stanze e che fungono da vere e proprie barriere: c'è bisogno di un oggetto come una piccola scatola per poterle superare. Per questo motivo la maggior parte delle stanze si riducono ad un mini-labirinto con pochissima libertà di movimento; a dir poco frustrante.
Oltre a questo ci sono diversi problemi di programmazione come certi nemici volanti che si piazzano agli angoli della stanza e diventano irraggiungibili a meno di avere un'arma a distanza; oppure mi è anche capitato che una chiave (essenziale per passare al livello successivo) sia letteralmente sparita nonostante fosse indicata sulla mappa.

Insomma è un gioco con molte buone idee ma il game design in sé non funziona, è troppo rigido e frustrante anche quando impari a convivere con le sue meccaniche.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064259546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1606014552}
review:
This game is quite far from being a SACK of nonsense, it's actually really damn good. Most of the time, you run around killing stuff and looting their corpses - you're essentially SACKing the areas you go through. The combat feels quite hack n SACKshy, and pulling off a parry is always SACKisfying.

The death penalty could use a rework - it's cool that you lose items upon death, and that you can send some back for future runs, but it kinda SACKs that you also lose 25% of your stats - if you then die before regaining those, you still lose 25% of stats you have now. This can lead to a downward spiral if you mess up too much or you don't play your cards right. I'd much rather you kept levels, but each level took exponentially longer to acquire, so that you're essentially softlocked before you can reach the later areas of the game. The crafting SACKstem is also pretty good - later on you can essentially SACK buff on top of buff on your weapons, making them op until later stages of the game. Some of the skills feel somewhat underwhelming.

The artwork is phenomenal - the game has a cartoon-like aesthetic, with hand drawn sprites for pretty much everything. Enemies and items have all of their angles manually drawn, which looks kinda goofy, but it fits in and brings a lot of charm to the table. Not to mention the SACKsy goblin pin-up posters littered around the first area, those really are a SACKht to behold.

The game is really hard though, so don't say you haven't been warned. However, the fact that I SACK down and played this for 5 hours in a row without realising should tell you all that you need to know.

....

Also, yeah, you can smack stuff with your burlap bag, in case that wasn't obvious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022680183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1612554218}
review:
Gekauft und wollte es nur kurz ausprobieren. Plötzlich sind drei Stunden weg. Unglaublich gute Spielmechanik. Macht riesig Spaß. Grafik vollkommen ausreichend und im Grunde perfekt. 
Gegner sind fordernd aber nicht übermachtig.
Mir gefällt sehr die Idee mit dem Beutesack, damit zugeschlagen und der Gegner ist im Besten Fall aufgespießt, abgestürzt oder Verbrannt.
Top.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272335246', 'num_games_owned': 562, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1632185468}
review: A friend Gifted me this game, I don't usually like RogueLikes but this isn't that bad, reminds me somewhat of area/daggerfall/battlespire for some reason but advanced (and feels better by a mile, if not even more harder, which is saying something)  i'm going to give this a 8.5/10 it's pretty dam decent, Good Job Dev, even impressive after learning only a single guy worked on this! (But also keep in mind that this game is nearly impossible to play on the normal mode, try easy it's better, i'd also suggest waiting for a patch, if it ever gets patched.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273926707', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1605824751}
review:
Çok güzel bir oyun. Belki aranızda Barony,Delver gibi oyunları bilenleriniz vardır. İşte o oyunlar tarzında bir rogue like.
Ben gayet beğendim fakat iade etmemdeki sebep sistem gereksinimi muhabbetleri vs..
Barony ve Delverden farklı çok yanı var. Silah geliştirme özelliği filan var.
Sisteminiz hemen hemen iyi ise bu oyuna bir şans verin.
Alt da yazan sistem gereksinimlerine bakmayın. Oyun daha çok yeni ve grafiklere ince ayar çekip oyununuzu akıcı hale getiremiyorsunuz. Yani en az bir gtx 800 serisi ekran kartı olması lazım bence. Tabi bu dediğim şimdilik geçerli,oyun daha yeni çıktı sonuçta. İlerleyen safhalarda belki bende gelip bir daha alırım.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042264833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 12038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 223, 'playtime_at_review': 5258, 'last_played': 1712004327}
review:
UPDATE: When the enemies get too tough IT'S TIME TO DIE. Throw your loot down the shoot then respawn and you'll speed through the level you were stuck on.

PREVIOUS: I first saw Damian's Imgur posts about Slasher's Keep before its release and I'm 88 hours into the game now. He has continuously made improvements and added new features/items. I'm still learning new tricks and finding components and weapons I hadn't before. Slasher's Keep is a lot of fun and easy to get into; I recommend it for anyone who enjoys slashing their way through dungeons and the endless search for better gear.

author: {'steamid': '76561198191829985', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 3914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1623531376}
review:
Das spiel ist gut für ein Doungen Crawler kommt an Delver ran fehlt aber noch ein bischen dazu.
Man merkt auch das der Entwickler sehr viel liebe in das spiel rein investiert hat. Z.b die Kleiner Käfer wenn man auf drauf geht sind die töt oder man kann sie essen.
Was ich schade finde das es kein Mod Support gibt das würde das spiel im einiges Interresanter machen und das die markt Gegenstände nicht gerade die schönsten sind.
Was aber richtig gut ist das man seine eigenen Waffen craften kann und später auch wieder nutzen kann wenn man sie in den Schacht schmeißt. Es ist auch Gut das man Angriffe abwehren kann, nicht nur sonder das man auch noch richtig steht muss, was die Sachen um einiges spaßiger machen. Viele monster und waffen aber Leider nur wenig Auswähl was Waffen Arten an geht.
Ich kann jeden das spiel Empfehlen der Spaß an Doungen crawler hat.


Viel Glück bei euren Run

If you're a fan of first-person dungeon crawlers ( ie, Barony, Delver, rooMaze..) Buy. This. Game. SERIOUSLY.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212444128', 'num_games_owned': 60, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 5357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1687261646}
review:
Прекрасный представитель жанра Rougelike игра имеет очень клевый визуальный стиль построенный на спрайтах отсылающий к старому поколению игр как и саундтрек хорошо подчеркивающий комичную атмосферу.

Сюжет как бы есть но подачи его нет и он сделать просто чтобы был но это не критично так как это в игре далеко не главное.

Геймплэй вот чем игра очень радует! бой почти такой же как и в dark messiah of might and magic что определенно плюс так как чувствуется отдача оружия при нанесении удара что зависит от типа оружия.

Также интеракция с окружением сделана  очень хорошо и заставляет постоянно пользоваться что делает бой немного зрелищней.

Генерация локаций немного странная и однообразная от чего устаешь но переходя на следующие этапы много чего добавляется в окружение те же ловушки или потайные комнаты что радует но хотелось бы побольше разнообразия.

Механика лута стандартна но вот крафт очень клева сделан что дает возможность создать абсолютно уникальное оружие используя разные части что очень хорошо ведь можно сделать идеальную вещь под себя.

Что же в целом игра заслуживает хотя бы ознакомления за счет всех вещей перечисленных выше и лично мне она очень нравиться.

Также хотелось что бы у игры была мастерская ведь это даст новый скачек к развитию игры а также рост популярности из за модов и большего контента.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006205876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 1141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1683234653}

author: {'steamid': '76561198315206781', 'num_games_owned': 3585, 'num_reviews': 1168, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1565184296}
review:
《Slasher' Keep》是一款第一人稱rogue爬塔遊戲，首先遊戲的畫風就讓人感到十分有趣，色彩明麗的美式卡通風格，讓遊戲看起來並不枯燥。遊戲為第一視角的rogue地牢，共計十層，玩家可以使用豐富的裝備來挑戰它們。整體難度略高，但是十分耐玩。有興趣的玩家可直接入手，絕對物超所值。

[h1]自定義地牢[/h1]

地牢中的每一層都是隨機的地圖，玩家需要在未知的地圖內尋找上樓的梯子，有點像魔塔的感覺，只不過是3D版本的，雖然整個流程只有十層，但是怪物的難度卻是成倍遞增，越往上走，挑戰會變得愈發困難。沒過三層是特定的boss更需要玩家沈著應對。從第四層開始地圖裏的陷阱會變得十分多也需要玩家加倍小心，不然很容易就會被清理出地牢。而一旦死亡就會從頭開始，不過不開即死模式的話，只會損失部分經驗和物品，算是一個不錯的輔助。

[h1]極度註重反應力的挑戰[/h1]

在本作中，基本上的遊戲難度都來自於對於反應力的考驗。遊戲的難度也來源於此，在戰鬥中，鼠標左鍵是輕重攻擊，右鍵就是格擋，基本上大多數攻擊全部可以通過格擋來抵消。但是這個格擋必須是對怪物出手方向的精確應對，不然不會判定格擋成功。所以很多時候能成功的格擋到怪物的傷害就會讓妳的旅程變得更加輕松，但如果妳應對錯誤的話，基本不會走的太遠。而且遊戲還有一個擊退的動作，玩家要善於使用這一點來把怪物打到陷阱上，可以讓冒險的旅程更加輕松。

[h1]豐富的裝備設定[/h1]

遊戲另一大特色就是裝備系統，拋去常見的裝備品質設定。玩家還可以自己打造裝備，通過冒險取得的零件來在熔爐上鍛造，這一點極大的豐富了遊戲的趣味，畢竟自己打造出來的武器屬性才更加偏向自己的喜好。而且各種詞條的豐富度也讓玩家更具有成就感。

[h1]小小的瑕疵[/h1]

目前看來遊戲的大體框架已經足夠有趣，剩下的就是一些小bug的修復已經最終的完善，目前遊戲還缺乏漢化翻譯，所幸遊戲的文本量並不算大，多熟悉之後也不會覺得特別困吶，唯一不舒服的地方就是有些裝備的詞條看不太明白。希望遊戲正式發售後會有中文本地化的添加。

author: {'steamid': '76561198010280803', 'num_games_owned': 4974, 'num_reviews': 327, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1559643836}
review:
slasher's keep是一款第一人称Roguelike地牢探险游戏，游戏采取了纸片化的美漫建模，粗犷的风格看起来相当独特，每关需要做的事情是探索地图，打败地牢中的敌人，获取战利品，培养自己的角色。躲避陷阱机关找到钥匙，然后前往更上一层的地牢，最后逃出生天。
 
战斗系统上可以通过吸引少部分敌人过来慢慢应付，不能直接莽，因为游戏里的玩家并不够强力，无脑的损血很不理智。可以依靠观察怪物的动向来用武器以不同方向进行攻击或招架，也可以蓄力等怪物过来给一下狠的然后拉开距离，同时需要注意攻击时机，比如远程骷髅会固定的冲上来，如果攻击时机不对很容易出现挥空的尴尬情况。场景中的陷阱也被利用，玩家可以用布袋把怪物击退到陷阱上或推下深渊。
 
难度还是颇高的，前面几层可能不明显，但是后面真的相当难打，只能靠死亡后保留自身大部分等级、属性点的设定来慢慢培养角色刷过去。机关也很让人头疼，可能因为独立制作者的关系，跳跃的手感很僵并且游戏设定的角色跳跃能力相当低，在某些跳跃机关中真的难操作。另外比较麻烦的是游戏里小地图画的挺抽象，而每关的场景并不小，导致个人这样的路痴经常在寻路中跑来跑去。

Slasher's keep is a first-person Roguelike dungeon adventure game. The game takes a piecemeal and American Comic model. The rough style looks quite unique. Everything you need to do is explore the map, defeat the enemies in the dungeon, and get the treasure. Avoid the trap to find the key, then go to the dungeon on the next level and finally escape.

The combat system can be slowly dealt with by attracting a small number of enemies. It can't be directly smashed, because the players in the game are not strong enough, and the brainless fighting is very irrational. You can rely on the movement of the monster to attack or parry with different weapons. You can also wait for the monster to come over and then pull the distance. At the same time, you need to pay attention to the attack timing. For example, the remote squat will rush in fixed time. The traps in the scene can be used too, and the player can use the cloth bag to knock the monster back into the trap or push down to abyss.

The difficulty is still quite high. The first few floors may not be obvious, but in late period is really quite difficult to play. You can only rely on the setting of most of its level and attribute points after death to slowly cultivate the character. The organization is also very troublesome. It may be because of the relationship of independent producers, the feel of jumping is very stiff and the character jumping ability of the game is quite low, which is really difficult to operate in some jumping institutions. What is more troublesome is that the pictures in the game are quite abstract, and the scenes of each level are not small, which leads to the direction idiots such as me often running around in the pathfinding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051585731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 371, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1558885381}
review:
[quote]
[th]关注[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/39039781]斗鱼游戏社区[/url]，随时了解主播推荐的好游戏。[/th]
[tr][th]访问[b]斗鱼鱼吧社区[/b]参与互动，活动好礼送不停！[/th][/tr]
[/quote]


[h1]前言[/h1]
《Slasher‘s Keep》是第一人视角的RPG冒险游戏。


[h1]游戏体验[/h1]
游戏的美术风格采用了卡通渲染，但却又不是完完全全的卡通渲染而是兼采用里Dos时代FPS游戏节省资源式样的面状态纸片渲染方式，举个例子就是，如果前面看到一盆火，当玩家走到它旁边时，这盆火的纸片会根据玩家角色的位置而旋转,达到“欺骗”的效果。通过这样的渲染方法既复古又节约资源，作为小成本游戏还是蛮不错的做法。

游戏的游玩体验则让笔者想到了昔日曾经游玩的《上古卷轴2：匕首雨》。玩家以第一人称操作主角,通过武器魔法与敌人战斗，角色搭载了布娃娃系统。玩家可以如果给角色面板装入不同武器，角色的外观也会随之改变。游戏中拾取的武器会有品质区别，高素质武器往往会带上一大堆强力buff。游戏自身也充满了不少黑色幽默要素，例如哥布林法师的攻击方式整个就一个巴啦啦小魔仙。游戏中的隐藏要素与技巧也不少。例如第一个隐藏关的铁皮小boss玩家怎么打也打不动，而是需要退开的方式将其被钉板扎死，某些不起眼的墙壁会藏着终要的机关......
不过游戏的死亡惩罚还是比较严重的玩家如果不慎挂断那么会强制一无所有从头再来。


[h1]总结[/h1]
总体来说是款素质还不错的第一人视角的RPG冒险游戏，推荐尝试。

author: {'steamid': '76561198098353911', 'num_games_owned': 9971, 'num_reviews': 895, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1558286598}
review:
你或许玩过无主之地，也接触过Roguelike，亦体验过地牢冒险，但却可能并没有想象过当Roguelike+无主之地+地牢冒险结合在一起会是什么样子，那么你可以试试下面这款笑笑推荐过的游戏。[i] [b] [u] Slasher's Keep，这是一款单人开发的第一人称Roguelike地牢冒险独立游戏，采用了美漫卡通的画风，与原本阴暗的地牢相搭配，更添特别的风彩。[/u]	[/b]	[/i]与画风极其相似的无主之地比较起来，其画面表现更加令人印象深刻，即便是对于游玩过多种地牢题材游戏的玩家来说，也会有一见钟情的感觉，如果厌倦了传统画风的地牢冒险，不妨换个口味来试试这一款。

[h1] [u] 是男人就上10层	[/u]	[/h1]
与其他地牢游戏不同的是，该作并非一路向下进行探索，而是从下至上爬梯冒险。地牢总分为有10层，玩家在每一层的任务是通过探索找到能解锁前往上一层区域的钥匙，随着层数的增加，攻略难度也越来越高，因此期间玩家还不得不击败敌人，获取经验升级，发现宝藏，找到装备武装自己。大部分情况是随机生成的地牢，部分楼层又是特定的强力BOSS房间，想要一口气通关并非易事，不过贴心的是每一楼层都提供了存档点，玩家可以自行保存并在下一次接着游玩，不同于其他同类游戏，一旦退出，其攻略的进度也将会被重置。

[h1] [u] +注重战斗技巧	[/u]	[/h1]
说到地牢冒险，当然离不开大大杀杀，不过与拿到神器就突突突的同类游戏不同，该作在战斗方面可十分有考究。无论是面对单枪匹马，还是成群结队的敌人时，玩家都不应盲目地随意挥舞武器进行硬刚，这样会得不偿失。游戏更鼓励玩家像个真正的英雄一样，不仅注重武器的一招一式，针对敌人的弱点进行致命打击，更要见机行事，见招拆招，格挡自如。攻击分为轻，重攻击（由按压的时间长短来决定），攻击的方式也分为左，右，下劈跟向前突刺。格挡类似，玩家需要预估并摸清敌人的攻击方式，从而进行不同方向上的格挡操作。此外，玩家还可以利用各种诸如尖刺陷阱，深渊等地形杀来消灭敌人。总的来说趣味性不低，也有一种玩中世纪战争跟骑马与砍杀的味道。

[h1] [u] +高随机性地图及道具	[/u]	[/h1]
游戏的随机性很强，几乎每次体验都能感受到不一样的味道，这极大提高了游戏乐趣。每次每一层楼随机的地图一般都很大，有的甚至大到路痴可能经常会迷路，甚至就连像我这种方向感很强的玩家来说，有时候也得好好研究下地图。地图上的所有内容都是随机的，包括商店，锻造武器房间，秘密区域，祭坛，传送带（传送物品回去，方便下次开局直接装备）以及各种怪物兼陷阱跑酷等房间。道具类似，不过比较看人品，若是遇到好的武器，则可以直接过五关斩六将。正是因为随机性过高，也导致一些问题，好比有时候可能会像我一样随机到一张死图，只能从头来过。

[h1] [u] +贴心的难度设定	[/u]	[/h1]
如果你是手残或者非酋，很难进行地牢攻略，别担心，你可以使用人海战术，这多亏了游戏的保留设定（人物每次死亡只会损失25%的金币，属性点，等级跟相关技能），因此即便是死亡，在下一局游戏中，玩家也能很快重振旗鼓。如果这样也不能满足你，还可以试试游戏提供的简单模式，不过代价是不能解锁相关成就。

[h1] [u] -音效的丢失与欠缺	[/u]	[/h1]
部分场景BGM或者武攻击的音效会随机出现丢失或者缺失的情况，使得玩起来不够更有沉浸感，也不算是缺点，只能说稍有影响体验，但总的来说无伤大雅，依旧该过瘾的过瘾，该上瘾的上瘾。目前处于EA阶段，很多东西不够完善，更何况该作是一人开发，因此进度就不要要求了，相信无论是现有的BUG还是后续的中文化都能够在正式版中见到。

    [/tr]

    [/tr]

author: {'steamid': '76561198202913131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 408, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1568094614}
review:
《Slasher' Keep》是一款美漫画风的第一人称地牢探险游戏，让人眼前一亮，玩家从一个牢房开始冒险，转角处和门后有着各种怪物在等着玩家，同样也有各种装备在等着玩家刷。玩家可以选择物理攻击和法术攻击，升级之后可以加点也可以学习魔法和技能。游戏可玩性挺强的，挑战性也很大。

[h1]有趣的地牢探险模式：[/h1]
游戏中需要玩家起初在一个空的牢房，牢房里有个箱子可以提供初始装备，初始装备也是随机生成的。随后玩家需要一个一个的探索地牢房间，当然绝大部分房间里是有各式各样的怪物在等着玩家，僵尸、兽人、飞蛾、地鼠啥的。击杀这些怪物后会掉落装备、药瓶。掉落的装备也都是随机的。玩家也不要忽略货物架上的东西和木桶里的东西，有时候也可以出一些不错的补给品。

[h1]刻意营造的难度：[/h1]
游戏体验一段时间后就会发现，游戏中极度缺少血瓶，主要是游戏中的格挡还是会少量掉血，第一人称操作有时候有十分变扭，敌人攻击时躲闪起来也不是很轻松，不过可以利用房门来进行卡位，不过这样小心翼翼的玩法确实大大降低了游戏的体验。

总的来说游戏让人眼前一亮，无论从画风还是玩法，都挺吸引人。

author: {'steamid': '76561198067811810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1692455457}
review:
Vorab:
Das Spiel wurde von 1 Entwickler komplett im Alleingang erschaffen. Eine bemerkenswerte Leistung. Wer mehr Hintergrundinfos, Entwicklungsdetails und die ein oder andere persönliche Anekdoten aus 1. Hand direkt vom Entwickler selbst erfahren möchte, kann sich gerne das Interview mit Damian Schloter hier anhören: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4zLqCgDrFGw

Mein Fazit zu Slasher´s Keep:
Ein tolles Spiel. Wer was für Rougelike-Dungeon Crawler übrig hat, der sollte sich Slasher´s Keep unbedingt mal anschauen. Das Kampfsystem erscheint auf den 1. Blick einfach, bietet im späteren Spielverlauf aber einigen Spielraum für Taktik. Außerdem muss man, wenn man denn mal scheitern sollte (und das wird oft passieren!!! Rougelike eben), nicht immer wieder bei 0 anfangen. Man verliert lediglich 25% seiner Skillpunkte und des Geldes. Außerdem kann man sich Gegenstände "sichern" und für einen Neustart direkt am Startpunkt verfügbar machen.

Das Crafting-System ist ein tolles Feature. Aus Einzelteilen kann man sich wirklich einzigartige Waffen zusammenbauen und diese auch benennen. Später im Spiel sieht die Waffe dann exakt so aus wie man sie im Bauplan angeordnet hat. Durch gezieltes Sammeln von Bauteilen kann man daraus teils mächtige Waffen anfertigen, die einem das Weiterkommen enorm erleichtern.

Da sich das Spiel stark an den Beutegegenständen (Waffen, Rüstung, Tränke, etc.) orientiert, gelangt man recht schnell in die bekannte Loot-Spirale. Nur noch eben diesen einen Raum mit der Kiste. Nur noch schnell diese Kurz-Quest fertig machen. Nur noch..... Aber genau aus diesem Grund spiele ich ja solche Games **grins**

Ich habe Spaß mit SK und werde es immer mal wieder gerne anfeuern und mich ´ne Runde durch die Gewölbe "slashen".

author: {'steamid': '76561198028159733', 'num_games_owned': 697, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 1695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1078, 'last_played': 1688776416}
review:
Never before have I seen melee combat done so well.
This game is absolutely great. I'd just recently tried to get back into mount and blade, but the mod I tried was crashing.
I was really looking for a good fantasy RPG mount and blade kind of game. Boy oh boy did this scratch that itch and even more that I didnt know I needed.

A big part of this game is movement, weight and knock back power. You can knock enemies into traps, off ledges or just make space to charge up another heavy attack. You level up and get various passive skills from challenges and... maybe just some early levels. These didnt feel like they did too much early.

Then I started to find activatable skills, things like Riposte. I started trying to get as much Riposte skill and as heavy of a sword as I could. I kept dying to the spider boss that gates off the second zone. Eventually I realized a little trick that does tons of damage to him (which I'll leave out so you can discover it)

Zone two is absolutely mind blowing. The first area became a 'try to find as much loot as possible while blowing through the levels kind of deal. But zone two makes me feel like indiana jones. So many traps, everywhere. You'd think they wouldnt be that hard to deal with but you're wrong. You WILL be in a position where you get your last tick of health shaved off by a trap you cant avoid while not getting hit in combat. 

I found a really cool hammer that lowers your attack speed but shoots an unblockable wave of fire after you swing. I found another skill that lets you charge up a stab longer to dash forward and deal alot of fire damage, and there's another I've found that lets you overcharge forward heavy attacks to deal even more damage.

The farther I get in this game the cooler it becomes. 

This game is an absolute gem, try it out. $11.19 (as of the steam sale currently) is a great asking price for this game. Recommend to anyone who likes first person fighting like mount and blade, dungeon crawlers and roguelikes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194793797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6492, 'last_played': 1704941174}
review: This game is well worth the full asking price. Very creative and challenging environments. The developer is great at responding to questions or potential bugs. He fixes and updates this game consistently. Recently he added more monsters, items, and a new boss. I can't wait for another edition to this game and I will gladly pay full price for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053069108', 'num_games_owned': 1282, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 2362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2350, 'last_played': 1544351956}
review: Reminds me of Daggerfall, but that's probably because I haven't played many dungeon crawlers. Although I'd love a more complex stat and skill system (perhaps my favorite part of the aforementioned Daggerfall) the game is very fun. Also infuriating when you die in a dumb way. I wouldn't consider that a con, however.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071802178', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1723, 'last_played': 1629495108}
review:
Graphics are really stunning, the game play is really nice and the loot system is plentiful. Combat easy to learn but harder to master, Sounds and voice acting are funny and good. game has stuff to do and re play ability.

downsides 

Some hit-boxes feel way too weird to the enemies and your weapons swings trough them.

Games parkour part plays quite horribly as sometimes you get stuck in the moving platforms and the maneuverability doesn't really help at all

some rooms feel way too crowded for their size so its easy to get stuck.
My instance was when i entered a new room, there was 3 melee enemies and 1 healing enemy. i pretty much had to use every consumable i had to get free for even a second.
The game is really good and nice to play already at Early access game. Keep adding new stuff dev/devs! God Speed ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198004997945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1538553293}
review:
WAY too difficult on normal mode. An "intended" way to complete the game is to make ~100 runs storing good ingridients and potions only to get to the next level where these items will mean next to nothing. Needless to say, that it takes an incredible amount of time (and RNG) to simply beat the game. Also, jump puzzles. 
With that being said, its a fun rogue-like. Nice art style, funny, interesting to play. Unpolished yet nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018404193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 886, 'last_played': 1655503623}
review: This game is pretty fun, and while some people dont like the combat i actually found it quite fun but if you only focus on doing the same attack over and over again it could be quite boring. its more complicated than it looks and everyone forgets kicks and traps can be used to your advantage. If you like the combat of mount&blade its pretty similar to that. the art style is the best thing as not too many games use it these days. thematically Slasher's Keep knows not to take itself seriously, everything about it is funny and strange. The best weapon i ever crafted was a giant screw attached to a stick. enemy magic casters just shoot cute little stars at you. its a fun time already and i cant wait to see how Slasher's Keep will turn out when its released.

review: I am really enjoying this game.  It brings some of the old nostalgia of the pure fun of dungeon crawlers that I haven't been getting with even similar genre modern games.  I can't quite place my finger on why but I really dig it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970892489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1002, 'last_played': 1581033403}
review:
This game is FANTASTIC. if you like dungeon crawlers, GET.IT.NOW. about the only complaint i have is that the movement feels a bit...sluggish. that being said however I understand the reasoning behind it with the various weapon speeds, and not wanting it to be too easy to dodge. the atmosphere is top notch, and it's satisfying to gather the various pieces of gear.  While I like that gear gives you skills (which so far seems purely passive), It would be nice if they implemented various skills that you could put points into as you level up. 

all in all though, love the game!
