author: {'steamid': '76561198126975019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 754, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1606349939}
review:
It's a fine game with a beautiful art style, and whilst it has a fairly simplistic gameplay, in terms of its mechanics, and systems.

It is a game with a lot of depth in the few mechanics, and systems it has.

The developer has been supportive enough, and he has even added an alternate level of difficulty for people who choose to play the game at a more relaxed, and care free, pace.

The big issue that I have with the game is the balance of difficulty, at around the fourth floor of the game or so, the game has a sudden difficulty spike that changes not only the enemies that you face but also the traps that you come across.

There isn't a gradual process through which this happens, and up till that point you'll probably lack the defensive items neccessary in order to progress further.

It is a problem to have a rogue lite game that understands the concept of a game that progressively becomes more and more difficult, but it is a completely different thing to have a game that forgets that part of making the game more difficult is to make the player stronger, in order to give him, or her, a fair chance in fighting against his, or her, foes.

So i'm torn in between recommending this, or simply not recommending it.

On one hand this is an incredible job for one guy, but on the other it is a game that requires a heck of a lot of development of its systems, and, or, mechanics, in correlation with its absurd, and sudden, difficulty increase.

Playing on "Easy mode" didn't make a single difference.

So you're pretty much reduced to replay the game again, over, and over, up until you get to the fourth floor, or any of the subsequent ones.

Memorize enemy patterns, develop strategies, and force yourself to change your style of play in order to bend to the game's will and requirement of not getting hit by almost any trap, or enemy around you.

It's a similar case of what happens in Enter the Gungeon with how the game becomes increasingly difficult but forgets that the whole concept behind a rogue-lite game, beyond procedurally generated levels, and random item drops, is the fact that while the game becomes more difficult, the player also becomes much more stronger.

The Binding of Isaac gets this, Nuclear Throne understands this to a lesser degree in favor of offering a much more challenging experience.

Slasher's Keep, and Enter the Gungeon do not.

This are rogue-lite games that require you to play them endlessly in order to then comprehend each of the different adversities thrown at you, so then you can overcome them.

I frankly don't have the time, or the patience to do such a thing.

Generally the game's enjoyment, and my so called "immersion" where grinded to a halt around this sudden difficulty "spike".

I would recommend the game to support the developer.

Between Enter the Gungeon, and Slasher's Keep, the difference is that Enter the Gungeon was created by a team of several different individuals, while this game was created by a single one.

Giving him the benefit of the doubth, and considering a neccessary experimentation in connection with the development that video games require, I can only hope for this to get fixed, or resolved in some way.

Otherwise I'll have to remain ambivalent, and upset that a game as creative, and clearly, as with much passion behind it, remains a game that excludes people like me from playing to simply appease other people that prefer a much more challenging, some might say, relentlessly, "gated" experience.

Maybe through altering "Easy mode" even further and not scaling the damage that the enemies do to player this can be resolved.

Either way, in its current state, I'll would go mixed, but knowing the general attitude that the developer has had toward his game, and the fact that he listens to feedback.

I just don't have the heart to not give it a recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198445832924', 'num_games_owned': 4003, 'num_reviews': 428, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1532645364}
review:
[quote][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32732116-IndieGems/]Follow our curator page: [b]IndieGems[/b] if you like and want to see more reviews like this one.[/url][/quote]

Slasher's Keep is a first-person roguelite dungeon crawler that focuses on melee combat with procedural generation in dungeon floors, items, etc. that is currently in Early Access.

The game offers everything in 2-dimensional hand-drawn art that is immediately very appealing to me. Everywhere you go, and everything you do feels like exploring in a pop-up story book. While the art-style is certainly not unique, it is certainly very well done. A lot of 3-dimensional appearing objects have several 2-dimensional sprites, so depending on the angle you are looking at them, different sprites show up. I really like the way the game looks, including some very amusing wall-art. 

There is a story, which you really don't need to read. There are two playable characters to begin with, and as you move from floor to floor, you have the option to read the small amount of lore that is embedded in the story. The game does throw your character's name into the story blurbs, which is nice. You can unlock more playable characters as you move on.

In the heart of the game is the procedural generation in the dungeon floors, the progressive difficulty of the levels, and as all roguelites, it has a Permadeath option. Fortunately there is also an Easy mode, so that gives you some options as to how you want to tackle this game. You can play Easy or Normal mode, with or without Permadeath. If you choose not to deal with Permadeath, you still lose 25% of your money, stats, levels, and associated skills every time you die. There is a item chute to be found on each floor after the first floor, and you can throw whatever you wish down this chute and it will be there if you die. And of course, you gain experience, level up, select which of your attributes you want to put your gained points in, and continue, the usual dungeon crawling way.

There are what appears to be alternating shop/crafting stations on every floor above the first as well, and crafting can be utilized to better your chances of survival, but is unnecessary. Though this is a great way to get items that have properties to your liking. Since the other items are randomly generated, you just never know what kind of RNG you will get.

This game focuses on melee combat, so that is how you will go through most of your combat. Enemies either walk/rush to you upon line of sight, or if they are a spell-casting type, they will always aim at you and continually cast immediately after their designated cool-downs. You can charge an attack with your melee weapon or do rapid swings, of course the charged attacks will do more damage. The Left Mouse Button is used for attack using your equipped weapon. There is a precise parry system built in, where you try to parry with the hold of the Right Mouse button that is very directional dependent. You have the best chance of a parry if you aim your parry in the direction of the incoming attack. You can also knock enemies back with your charged attacks or your inventory sack, and if you knock them into spikes or pits, they usually do not fare too well.

There are ranged weapons in the form of magical wands or other similar things. You can wield and use these, but they drain your mana fast. This game is designed to be mostly melee and occasional ranged. [spoiler]If you have an enemy flying over a pit, using ranged attack is definitely the preferred attack option. Trust me, I learned the hard way.[/spoiler]

You equip your loot findings throughout the floors from chests that are always shiny or just from enemy drops. Some of these loot are directly usable items, others are crafting parts that you can use  to fashion your own items.

You have a fairly limited inventory, unfortunately, and often I find myself running back and forth between the shop and the random loot on the floor on those floors that have a shop. The shop really does not pay much for your items, but there are usually one or two pieces of equipment that is an improvement or a crafting piece that I really want in the shop, so I spent a lot of time running in and out of the shop. It would be nice to be able to carry a bit more.

Picking up items and equipping items can sometimes be a bit troublesome, especially because everything is a 2D sprite, a lot of items have fairly large sprites that shadows other items not in the foreground. Picking up everything in this stack of pancake-styled items is also not always feasible, since the game does not allow you to pick something up if your inventory is full. It would be nice to allow the player to pick up and hold with the mouse cursor and set the item aside in another location on the screen. Instead, the item just get spat out if you try to pick it up and your inventory does not allow currently. 

There is a mini-map that is fairly difficult to see, it is located in the top left corner and is just too small. The entrances to the rooms are also not too easily seen. It would be nice if this could be made into an in-game full screen partially transparent overlay on a button press toggle.

In addition, there are some known performance issues with GeForce 10 series cards, and I experienced this myself. According to the developer, launching the game in Direct 3D 11 mode helps, but I was still experiencing some issues with this.

The jump ability is unfortunately just not quite enough to clear most physical hurdles, and so there are times when I was in a room with a lot of stairs and railing, and trying to jump past the railing just never worked. There are also some physical stairs that do not allow you to directly walk up them. So I would be on some stairs and needed to jump to keep moving up the stairs. Another time I got stuck in a area closed off by walls on two sides and these railings on two sides. I got in from above, but couldn't get out, and had to restart. One time I jumped and got hit by an enemy, and got knocked back into a pit--instant death. I never knew that climbing stairs would be so potentially detrimental to my health.  

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
Slasher's Keep is a very neat-looking first-person roguelite dungeon crawler that uses a lot of 2-dimensional sprites to simulate a 3-dimensional feel, offers mainly melee fights, and is fairly difficult. All of the dungeon floors undergo procedural genreation, and so the game has a lot of replay value. There are enough enemy types who have different abilities to keep you on your toes. The game offers an Easy mode and Permadeath is optional, making it a bit more forgiving and allowing it to reach a wider audience. It is still in Early Access and there are times while playing that it feels a bit clunky and could use some fine-tuning and polish. It is a fun game, without a doubt, and you should seriously consider it. Current version (0.72) I would rate as 7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198323559381', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1681732752}
review:
游戏本身质量极好，6.25后购买游玩未发现任何bug。

入坑是很久前看王老菊玩的，对这类画风有点兴趣，看打折就买了。

总的来说游戏内容方面还是比较丰富的：技能，装备，怪物特性，小boss法师特效（好想拿他的法杖放个大），地图解密。
总共10关，10后面基本就是从头开始的无尽模式了。前面9关中每三关一个地图风格。
1-3是上面介绍里图片展示的地牢风格，主要特点是找隐藏门上高台拿钥匙或者地图联通。
4-6是类似于金字塔感觉的，会有爬楼的内容，主要特征是冲刺铁甲怪+大量机关（地刺，摆锤为主）。
7-9是城堡（大概）有图书馆有卧室啥的，主要特征是双刀小怪+360度旋转机关（可关闭）+衣柜藏门。
10关是boss关，进门正式打boss（似乎是被操控的男主妹妹？？）前会有支援点三连——锻造炉，商人，存货点。进去后不能再返回，通关后直接重置回第一关。打完后会有绕房一周的箱子开（看脸，不一定是好装备）+boss掉落双刀+boss尸体（可拾捡是什么操作？？？我拿装备去了空间不够捡尸体就没管）。

游戏机制决定了这是一个需要在死亡中积累的游戏。前期死的较快，第一个瓶颈大概是第3关，这个时候需要利用锻造+装备继承积累一套绿装出来，打法稳点比如单拉+勾引踩陷阱+F踢上陷阱或踢下悬崖，可以减轻对防具的要求。此时期装武器伤害最好冲到100-200阶段（一般是重武器，我靠合成出的），此伤害可以保证你在三下蓄力内秒掉绝大多数怪。第二个瓶颈大概是第五关左右，此时应着手把装备换为蓝装（从这层商店会爆蓝装），攻击提升至250-400左右。4-6图内必须熟练掌握跳高台阶梯，不然会伤很多血甚至卡关。接下来进入7-9图，商店会出紫装，本人运气好摸到了400+的武器，怪基本4刀蓄力内搞定。需要注意的是有绿骷髅和紫骷髅的时候一般房间里会有一个能力祭坛，他们喷完能量会下去取，可以这个时候上去平A清掉。1-9我走的基本是重武器路线，但boss前摸到了金色剑，就换了。进去发现boss的血那叫一个厚，估计有20000+。双刀伤害高，貌似无特殊技能。我靠剑的连击打她硬直慢慢推到后面的钉墙上3-4次左右推死，带缴械技能的话可以把她双剑打掉，全部打掉后她不能攻击会去捡剑，可以输出。

前期的辛苦到中期舒服发育到最后幸运卡bug通关，这游戏给我的体验相当不错，推荐！但通关后重复关卡有种喂shi感，希望能有以后内容能有更多更新吧！


我先删为井敬。

author: {'steamid': '76561198013027885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 1135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1582924632}
review:
When I first tried this game out months ago, I didn't much care for it, but recently it's really improved a lot, combat is satisfying, leveling is alright, I don't feel much of a change in my character outside of getting stronger weapons. 

I say get it!

review: Slasher's Keep by měl stát víc než 14€, je to úžasná rogue-like hra s originální grafikou, bojovím systémem, výrobou zbraní, širokým sortimentem nepřátel a velkým arzenálem zbraní a kouzelných hůlek. Doufám že v budoucnu přidají třeba kopí, štíty nebo třeba kuši do jedné ruky. Ještě jsem zapoměl zmínit že nepřátele můžete přetáhnout po hlavě svím inventářem! Rozhodně Slasher's Keep doporučuju.

review: A solid dungeon bash with a bit of a skill curve at first. Once you figure out how to fight, it gets really fun and rewards you for being quick and efficient without putting a big timer up on the screen. One of the few non-ASCII games that deserves the roguelike description.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020313592', 'num_games_owned': 986, 'num_reviews': 576, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1526948641}
review:
[h1] Review - Slasher's Keep [/h1]

===

[h1] RATING: 7.5 / 10 - Prison Break [/h1] 

===

[h1] Overview [/h1]
Slasher's Keep is a first person action roguelite focused on melee combat and dungeon exploration. Confined to rot in a cell deep in the bowels of Slasher's Keep, you suddenly find a chance to escape your destiny, you take it, and your escape begins to reach the top of the dungeon and run away. In this perilious journey you will have to fight dangerous monsters of all sorts: undeads, giant molerats, slimes, animated skulls to name only a few, level up your character, find always new and powerful weapons and items to equip, explore vast dungeons full of traps and secrets, all in a melee-oriented, brutally violent combat style that is easy to learn but hard to master, and where timing is of the essence. With procedural dungeon and loot creation, roguelite elements, optional permadeath, and varied enemies, Slasher's Keep is definitely, already, a solid game in the roguelike/lite genre.

===

[h1] Gameplay Analysis [/h1]


[b] General Gameplay [/b]
Slasher's Keep gameplay focuses mainly on combat, exploration and resource management, as any good roguelike should. I will talk about combat in the next section. For exploration, each level of the dungeon is procedurally generated with different patterns each time, and filled with secret rooms, hidden panels, traps, traders, bonus encounters and more, so variety is guaranteed as no two floors will ever be the same. This of course partially ties the progression to luck, as an unlucky floor generation with little positive things and many traps and negative encounters will make your escape a lot harder, with the possibility of death, but such is the nature of roguelike games in the end, so no big deal.

Permadeath is optional in this game, and if not enabled, when your HP reaches zero you will be dragged back in your cell on Floor 10 and lose all your items, and part of your money and attributes gained by leveling, and of course, you will have to traverse all the Keep again. Some items can be retained through death by using item chutes, special objects that appear randomly in floors from time to time, and allow you to send any item to your cell, ready to be used immediately in case of defeat and return to the cell.

Item generation is aswell procedural and items each have different speed values, armor, damage values, damage types such as slash, blunt, magical, etc. - and special attributes that confer your character unique bonuses, such as life steal on attack, bonus damage against certain enemies, or more attack speed. Items can also be crafted at Forges if you are lucky enough to find the, during your escape you will find all sorts of item parts, and at a forge you can combine them together to craft powerful custom gear that best suits your character.

Character progression consists in a rather simple level-up system giving you four attribute points, to spend in Intelligence, Strenght or Dexterity, to receive the relative bonuses to each attribute, it will be up to you how to manage them and decideeither to go for a pure, single-attribute class or a mixed attributes jack of all trades, depending on your play style. Performing chain kills in a short amount of time boosts experience gained, so the game rewards bold, quick moves against multiple enemies, but being too reckless will result in quick death.

As in any roguelite, resource management is important, as your inventory space is limited and each floor contains abundant items and resources to be gained. It will be up to you to decide what to keep, what to sell, and what to send to your cell to plan in advance for your very likely next defeat. Decisions, decisions.



[b] Combat System [/b]
Combat in Slasher's Keep is mainly focused on Melee even if there are ranged weapons such as magical wands. Clicking the left mouse will perform attacks continuously, while holding it will perform a much more powerful charged attack, of which you can also decide the direction by combining WASD+Click. Right click is for parrying. This is certainly not a button-mashing type of combat, as timing for when to parry and when to attack will be fundamental to win a combat. Enemies are vicious and will wait for you to charge attacks to strike on their own, exploit your weaknesses, and work together, for example support enemies will heal and buff melee ones that will charge at you in the meantime.

You also have a magical wand at your disposal, your ranged weapon, that costs Mana to be fired, and also your loot sack, usable each set amount of time as a powerful interrupting weapon, useful to push enemies insidetraps, spikes, or cliffs. Understanding the usage of all these weapons takes time and practice and is easy at first but then becomes more complex and tactical.


[b] Content [/b]
Since the mostly procedural content, the replayability is theoretically infinite, and variety is abundant.


[b] Balancing [/b]
The game is difficult, but fair, i did not see any particular unbalance.


[b] Challenge [/b]
The game starts off quite nicely but then difficuly suddenly becomes much more serious after some floors cleared. A good challenge.


===

[h1] Technical Analysis [/h1]


[b] Graphics [/b]
With a very original art style, this game totally conveys a brutal, dark fantasy world in an unique way, really a good job. I completely fell in love to this graphical style that so few games use nowadays (cel shading), it is the right point between a comic book and a 3D game. 

[b] Sound [/b]
Weapon sounds are good, impacts are aswell, effects in general are of average quality.

[b] Performance [/b]
Nothing to report.

[b] Stability [/b]
Nothing to report.

[b] AI [/b]
Enemy AI is vicious, will wait for openings in your guard, collaborate, surround you, and in general give you a hard time in your escape.

[b] Quality of Life [/b]
Nothing to report.

[b] Bugs / Issues [/b]
N/A (Early Access)

===

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]
Slasher's Keep is a solid roguelite game with good melee combat, satisying progression, challenging enemies and a lot of variety. I'm really waiting it to come out of Early Access and see how better it can become.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983699067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1551045525}
review:
Starts off ok, then gets cheap and cunty. Im not talking difficulty in combat. When you die you start back at level 1, losing all the gear you had (and didnt deposite down an item chute) part your level, stats, and so forth. Im actually down with that.

The bullshit gets to the really crappy jumper puzzles in first person with laggy controls. be prepared to do the same jump pattern 30 times a level to get up a shaft with the same disappear reappear platforms which have this tendancy to snag you so you cant jump, cant move, or do anything cept fall and start all over again.

I liked the weapon crafting, you make some rather goofy weapons OF DOOM and other such, and the armor you get makes it hard to take your character seriously (currently wearing a plague doctors helmet, edwardian dress shirt, giant plate PAULDRONS, and leafs for shoes.

Id like to suggest it as its fun, but just the jumper puzzles kill it. first couple i could just skip, but eventually no, your stuck doing them if you want to pass the level. I just washed my hands of it after that.

review:
Ну что могу сказать. Эта игра стоит своих денег! Я не помню, то-ли её делает 1 человек, то-ли несколько но я могу сказать что игра растёт. Добавились новые модели комнат, реже стали баги с генерацией ( но всё равно есть) 
Ну из минусов как обычно
1. Крафт оружия... когда много способностей то ты без понятия о его характеристиках. ибо они далеко вверху. 
2. Иногда блок игнорируется ( блокировать я знаю как, не только зажимом кнопки)
3. Всё ещё не стабильный баланс комнат. Этажи скачкообразно сложность меняют. ну возможно это даже и плюс. 
Я бы ещё на самом деле задонатил разрабам за какое-либо дополнение, например за новые стили этажей. Советую, ибо тут видно, что разработчики пока не забросили свой проект!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974207428', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1554632591}
review:
This is going to be a harsh positive review.

I'm going to start off by beating the game into the ground, because really, that's what it does to you, it beats you down and tries it's hardest to break your spirit.
It's not a great casual game, you can very easily find yourself going backwards due to how much you lose from dying, if you can't recover everything lost from your most recent death before your next one you'll find yourself going backwards or even just nowhere. A good example of this was that I was strong enough to get to level 4, I died losing my best gear, lots of money and lots of experience, since then it's a struggle to get past level 2 again.
It doesn't help that combat is a bit clunky, sometimes you can block an attack only for it to still connect anyways, I know you're supposed to direct your sword to successfully block, but theirs just passes through on occasion.

It's the harshest rouge-like I've played so far simply due to how easy it is to die from a bug like that or failing to be able to switch to your melee weapon because you're aiming down sights with the wand, there's no way to turn off 'toggle' either, so you need to press it again to be able to change weapon.

The procedural generation of the maps can be a little off sometimes too, like a door requiring a copper key only for there not to be one on the entire level, I moved on to the next level thinking I could find a key later on and come back, only to find you can't go back through the levels.
The level sizes are also a part of the difficulty problem, due to the levels being so small there is only so much experience you can obtain from one level which makes it feel like the game is heavily rail-roading you into the wall that is the games difficulty curve. Didn't get enough XP from those last 2 levels? Too bad then, you're probably going to die to the first enemy you see on this level.


All that being said, I absolutely ADORE the art style, it's brilliant, the game runs super smooth and there are little details that have been thought of that other games don't; for instance if you kill an enemy near a drop/hole then the items will appear where he was last standing before it was killed, no need to worry about keeping them away from ledges.
I also love the range of abilities and loot, the weapon crafting is really impressive and the player movement feels very natural.

I do find myself rage quitting fairly often, especially when I'm killed by something really simple, but I find myself jumping back on the game every now and then to see if I can make some progress.

I'd love to see a fully fleshed out game without procedural-ly generated maps, or just have them as dungeons in a larger open world type game.
Also, the positive reviews this game is getting, and the success of the Borderlands series proves that not all gamers want the highest levels of graphics, but instead just want really fun games.

I do recommend the purchase, especially at such a low price, I hope to see more from this dev.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962318911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1024, 'last_played': 1645588572}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054240620', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2189, 'last_played': 1683224271}
review:
Slasher's keep is a dungeon-crawling game where you must fight to escape a prison.
You can pick from a variety of characters that unlock in certain ways. Each one has a different story.
You must keep getting to new levels to find out more of your character's story.

When you choose a character, you must also choose what to do when you die. You can enable permadeath, or just keep it at softcore, where you loose 25% of your levels and the skills obtained from them.
This means that when playing without permadeath, you will start back at the beginning, but with most of your experience and skills, and therefore you have an advantage. And even you, the player, will gain your own personal experience, and know how to better survive the dungeon.

The dungeons are randomly generated. So are the items, with their damage, armor, bonuses, and included skills. This is what drove me into Slasher's Keep.
The items even look different based on their rarity, so it's even more satisfying to find rare items.

Also, you can make your own weapons, if you have the parts, and are on every other level, alternating with the shop.
Even the parts are randomly generated, but categorised into hilt + blade / shaft + head types.

I'll explain the one minor issue I have. If, like me, you only pay attention to the main stats of an item (damage and armor), you'll notice you'd choose a mace, because of the high damage.
What I want is for all weapons to have the same range of damage so that I can use all the weapon types more often.

Another issue I have is that the game doesn't pause when you press esc.

This game is definitely worth buying, even if you are bothered by those two issues I listed.

review: I can see where this might be fun for a while for others, and honestly expected to like it better myself.  The combat just really fell flat for me, and with that as the core of the game I found nothing compelling me to play.  I knew it was going to feel floaty and disconnected just from the trailer, but it was worse than I was prepared for.  I think the art style is cool and am always glad to see someone make a new dungeon crawler.  But for me I could see very early on where the combat was going to be unsatisfying.  I might check it out again at a future time.  For now I asked for a refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996739663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 968, 'last_played': 1674005443}
review:
This is one of my favorite independently developed dungeon crawls on Steam. The art style is very unique, and it uses sprites rather than polygons for the monsters and many of the objects that you encounter. I appreciate this both for the nostalgic looks, and the ridiculously high performance that this design choice provides. This game will happily run at 144fps+ on mid-spec hardware, and it looks very good doing it. The combat mechanics are also very nicely done. This is especially impressive when you consider the fact that this is an indie game developed by one person. Often, combat is one area that many indie devs really struggle to get right. I'm happy to report that this is not the case with Slasher's Keep. Well done, Mr. Schloter!

There are a few things that I would like to see the developer work on while the game is still in EA. First - and I realize that this is an entirely subjective opinion - but the music didn't leave a very good first impression. Fortunately the game options allow you to turn the music off, so this really isn't a huge deal. Still, I was struck by how annoying the music is when I first booted up the game. Second, some of the sound design is rather questionable. Most of the effects are quite good. The player-character & monster grunts, groans, and yells are all perfect. The issue that I have is with the magic sounds. When a wand is used, for example, it quite literally sounds like one of those toy Disney princess wands. Perhaps that is what the dev was going for, but I found it to be disconcerting. 

Aside from those minor niggles, I think this is an excellent game, even in its Early Access state. I definitely recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054000381', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1032, 'last_played': 1559840011}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001807994', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 874, 'last_played': 1637631009}
review:
I'm very pleased by this game, it's easy to get into, coffee break friendly, beautiful graphically, and just very fun to play. 

Essentially, you get random weapons and armor locked by the floor your on to be a certain tier: you gain XP by killing monsters, and even more XP if you do so in a combo, and you get levels and stats to level up.

Death is a certainty, and the game depends on you dying - you lose items adn some stats, but keep everything else, and so you get a little better each time... you also get the ability to save items by dropping them in a "loot chute" that puts the items where you start the game on a new game, and you can craft weapons from various parts.

There's magic in the form of wands, but thats it. 

The best way to play this game is to run around killing monsters at a fever pace, ensuring you get the maximum bonus, only picking up weapons as you go on your spree, and THEN going back to explore. 

Eventually, you'll be forced to slow down and fight more technically by blocking, dodging, zapping enemies with wands, and otherwise avoid going berserk, because you'll hit a stat-wall. you wont be strong enough to progress, and enemies will proceed to one,two, or three shot you to death depending on how far you managed to progress. 

and then you die, run through weak enemies to farm XP, and do it all again. 

This game can be very frusterating for that reason, and it might not be a game for everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198229739108', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1273, 'last_played': 1645586761}
review:
有空就能刷一局的大菠萝式第一人称rpg，加上随机生成的地牢，反正我已经停不下来了。。总的来说是个不错的游戏。

吐槽一下：死亡惩罚非常硬核，一死回到解放前；地图生成有小几率bug；层数难度向上呈几何增长，虽说是个延长游戏时间的设置，但也让游戏难度大大增加；物品栏容量真的小，后面一大堆配件根本装不下。
建议：怪物种类希望能再增加，目前的场景还是单调了点；没有中文也不影响游戏体验，有中文更好。

author: {'steamid': '76561197991591636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1538687936}
review:
The game has a lot of charm, and its got a ton of potential... level 1 is super fun, level 2 is super challenging.... level 3 and beyond are not just hard... they are Unfair.

Enemies can 1 shot you at level 4 and beyond... and there are 12 levels.... the game goes beyond hard and challenging fun and becomes Unfair stacked against the player at a ridiculous curve almost immediatly.

This isnt the fun kind of hard... its the frustrating and infuriating kind of hard.   The option to select permadeath or not hardly matters as well... as you lose 25% of each stat, and all skills and 25% of max level as well upon death... if you die two times in a row (super easy to do cause of RNG) you effectively have permadeath anyway... and this can erase hours of gameplay instantly.


Unless this is addressed and changed I cannot recommend this game.






UPDATE - as of 10/4/2018:    Almost nothing has changed... Dev has added "easy mode" which equates to absolutely nothing but a menu check... it changes nothing about the gameplay nor the extreme punishment of dying when you dont want a permadeath playthrough.

avoid this game, the Developer... while active in his forums, ignores his customers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134086602', 'num_games_owned': 995, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1612670127}
review:
Les dejo un video con mi primer vistazo del juego: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zQHF-UULKsI 

Slasher´s Keep es un juego de rol y acción en primera persona, en el que tendremos que tratar de escapar de una prisión de 10 pisos. Cada uno de los pisos, como sus criaturas, trampas y tesoros se dispondrán de manera procedural por ser un "roguelite", por lo que nunca jugaremos 2 veces a la misma partida. Podemos optar por muerte permanente, o poder continuar con nuestro personaje si nos matan con penalización en nuestros stats, oro y pertenencias, pero si las pudimos salvar en unos lugares especiales aparecerán para poder usarlas en nuestro próximo intento.
Me ha gustado mucho la estética de los gráficos, y cada nivel tiene un diseño que casi ni se nota que fue creado de forma aleatoria. Además tiene un sistema de crafteo en el que podremos construir con partes que iremos recolectando nuevas armas y armaduras (eso todavía no lo vi en mis primeras 2 horas de juego, me mataron demasiadas veces XD).
El juego en cada piso se va poniendo difícil, pero es muy entretenido ya que siempre vamos a ir encontrando nuevos enemigos, trampas y hasta sencillos quests que nos ayudaran a subir de nivel o conseguir items especiales.
Los combates pueden ser con armas melee (con distintos tipos de ataques según nuestros movimientos con el mouse y el teclado) o a distancia con varitas mágicas, y el diseño de las mismas es muy variado.
Realmente es un juego muy bueno y lo recomiendo para los amantes de los RPG de acción!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974637171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1581570873}
review:
pushing over the gate
to my cell i find a tiny note
saying be back later. upon
opening the chest i am armed
with a Toddlers Skull Crusher
(a shoe tied to a stick)
and a basic wand. Crawling
through the dungeon I crush
moaning mole men. mmmuuuhhh.
entering the next room a gate closes
behind me. surrounded by zombies
I whhhhip out my wand. KACHHHHOW!
wand shotgun rips the zombies in twain. 

Shotgun Wands SUPPER 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198184981423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1708, 'last_played': 1603977196}
review:
在16小时的奋斗之下达成了一周目通关，这个游戏太有趣了！
·武器：短剑，长剑，战斧，战锤，又可分为剑类和长柄类，有两种不同的动作模组
·装备：头盔，胸甲，腿甲，臂甲，靴子，法杖，戒指，项链，披肩多种装备物....不过强大的搭配不一定好看
·锻造：收集柄，刃，锤头，剑格，宝石等等素材，在铁砧上就可以打造出你想要的[strike]圣诞树[/strike]]武器
·敌人：发现了你就追到死的AI，虽然不少时候会自己撞墙，目前只有四种形态（苍蝇，史莱姆，鼹鼠，哥布林）

游戏性20/10      BUG-3  Crash-3 战斗重复度较高-2 跑图太大太杂-2 overall 10/10
ex:通关一周目以后二周目可以自选层数来挑战（10-99，以及无限）
/2019-1-7
THE GAME YOU KILL EVERYONE IN ONE TAP

author: {'steamid': '76561198323678803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1518699895}
review:
Slasher’s Keep is a visually striking, atmospheric, and detailed first-person dungeon crawler that I hate with the burning passion of a thousand dumpster fires.

For a single developer, it’s an extremely impressive project. The difficulty may feel cheap, but the attention and care gone into design is clear. On top of this, Slasher’s Keep does have character. Nothing about it feels cynical, It’s just going to require a very specific type of player to get the most out of. If you’re looking for a fun, casual dungeon crawl, or even one that offers a clear route of progression for getting more heavily involved over time, Slasher’s Keep is currently not that game. 

Overall, A quirky first-person dungeon crawl with some interesting interplay between systems and a wide variety of loot, let down by baffling and frustrating difficulty spikes. Getting parts of my pretend body torn off in fantasy settings is fun. Genuinely wanting to mutilate myself is not. 

Read The Full Review Here: https://oldgrizzledgamers.com/reviews/slashers-keep-review-pc-keep/

author: {'steamid': '76561198145414211', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1646950181}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970625686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1625762728}
review:
Charming graphics!  Wonderfully randomized layouts and rooms.  Diablo-like itemization and an original, satisfying take on crafting.  On top of that, the combat is weighty and delilberate.

A truly impressive effort for a one man team.  15 dollars well spent to enjoy what's already here and to encourage more.

Personally, I would love to see further elaboration on the exploration gameplay.  Whenever there's a permanent minimap, I can't resist the urge to have it on all the time, which results in less satisfying exploration, as I find myself with one eye on the map constantly.  I realize some people would prefer it that way, but I would love for it to be more deliberate, say, having to equip the map or make it take up the full screen.  Or even having to find the map and compas a la Zelda or Hollow Knight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125155618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1415, 'last_played': 1655930482}
review:
From the art style to the little voice acting there is, this game is truly a gem.

The objective is climbing up through the floors of a dungeon, killing monsters, gathering items, discovering secrets and even crafting your own weapons, to fight against a Boss located at the top floor. The crafting aspect of the game took me entirely by surprise, the moment I found a forge and discovered that I could make my own creations with the resources I gathered (and even name them!) made me so happy, I just love having my own weapon designs and actually see and use them in-game.

The combat feels pretty good, as you progress, you'll find other ways to fight the enemies you'll encounter where you don't even have to worry about parrying their attacks, but I have found myself clashing swords and parrying attacks for a while with some of them and it feels pretty awesome.

There is elemental damage like fire and ice, and all kinds of perks that give you some advantages like regenerating mana on your own, making the severed head of a monster explode, etcetera. You can get them either leveling up, via armour or via weapons. Here the weapon crafting plays a huge role, as you can gather the resources you need to create something with the perks you want.

The sound design is very good, everything sounds as you would imagine and it fits perfectly with the environment, from the grumbling of your character, to eating some critters straight from the ground. The voice acting, for what it is (and I mean, there aren't many NPCs or else with real dialogue on it), is wonderful. Especially the shopkeeper. I'm in love with that character, he's without any doubts my favourite.

As I said, there are some minor issues that I have experienced at the time of writing this review, like some doors not showing up on the map, when dying and loading for some reason the map resets (you have to discover what you already discovered before, and fill up the blank map again), on higher levels, the monsters tend to deal lots of damage even if you are well-prepared for them, but once you learn to move around, parry precisely and use your environment (such as spikes, traps or bottomless pits) to kill your enemies, you can pretty much be untouchable. But as I said, the developer is actively working on the game, so there's nothing to worry about!


To sum up, Slasher's Keep it's a magnificent game that will provide many hours of entertainment by exploring all the dungeons' sizes (small, medium... even infinite!), completing quests/achievements, creating all kinds of weapons (the weirder, the better), unlocking new characters (that have different initial perks), using all kinds of wands to see what they do, managing your inventory and knowing what to send through the hatch for your future self, and discovering all the secrets that lie within the dungeon's floors. And also by wasting all my money at the shop to hear those sweet sweet voice lines. I strongly recommend grabbing this game!


Go get 'em tiger!

author: {'steamid': '76561198264785592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1357, 'last_played': 1580890229}
review:
个别生成的地图会有BUG（密码输对了机关没反应、藏在书里的键盘失灵、密道门口被熊头堵住、密室没有秘密通道、史莱姆掉到地板下面......）但是不能遮盖这个游戏的优点，作为手残党只能默默窝在门口勾引，苟活过关，但是我还是要说：
非常带感！！！欲罢不能！！！
非常带感！！！欲罢不能！！！
非常带感！！！欲罢不能！！！
作为体验版的游戏来说还有很大的提升空间，期待汉化版和更丰富的剧情，为《Slasher's Keep》点赞！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198006172825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1056, 'last_played': 1587129641}
review:
While most Early Access Games offer only a small proportion of the potential they promise to have in the end, Slashers Keep is already a huge and complete game. 

It took me quite a while to learn the game and make good progress but now I have a glimpse of the Content Slashers Keep contains. And its huge - I promise!

- Crafting is great (though I wish there would be a crafting station and Shop on every level) and very detailed

- Random Levels are challenging

- Combat is hard but fair

- Humor is also very good and etraordinary


My only wish for the future would be to connect the game somehow to the steam workshop and make modding possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214201733', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1274, 'last_played': 1610184645}

author: {'steamid': '76561198158844995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1614769413}
review:
Add PRIORITY OF ACTIONS!  Blocking should prempt attacking. Critical for such an action game.
Sort the action queue before processing it should do that.
是一款好游戏，但是格挡动作不能抢占攻击，对动作体验影响极大。在作者加入类似优先级系统以前，建议观望，不推荐购买。

author: {'steamid': '76561198036256177', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1663862358}
review:
作为一位热爱类rougelike游戏的玩家，看到这款游戏的时候觉得非常新颖。
总的来说在我的印象里，该游戏评分为 8.5/10
以下是我认为的该游戏的优点和缺点
优点：
-新颖的第一人称视角 3分
-丰富的地图资源及装备 2分
-细腻的战斗系统决定了你的装备并不是影响胜负的唯一关键 2分
-画面风格 1.5分

缺点：
-地图光影效果仍待优化，作为一名FPS游戏的老玩家仍然会感到头晕  -0.5分
-开局难度较大，在未熟悉战斗系统之前极易被虐 -0.5分
-时有时无的音乐让这个游戏玩起来有点恐怖 -0.5分

以上为我觉得此游戏存在的优点与不足。作为一个早期开发游戏，我仍然非常期待其之后的优化与更新。
如果能开放创意工坊的话，也许能让这个游戏拥有更多的活力。

author: {'steamid': '76561197968561644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 2253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 874, 'last_played': 1565463249}

author: {'steamid': '76561198326943050', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1370, 'last_played': 1604068050}
review:
魔卡小樱模拟器!!!

跟随逆风笑的脚步,发现这游戏真的比想象中的还要好玩.
就是没有官中看技能有点吃力.
玩了一个小时我才看懂地图!中途我还在第二关迷路了,找了半天的路最后选择了死亡
[spoiler] 大锤天下第一[/spoiler]
补充:
1,千万不要在魔法棒蓄力时摁Q换武器;
2,不要在空中(跳起来的时候)摁E进入存储箱放武器;
不要问我为什么!
继续补充:
14小时通关了!本来最高就打到5层,结果最后一把神仙附体直接打到10层(最后一层就是boss,貌似是个被控制的妹子).
我拿着一把蓝色的500攻的锤子,和一个绿色的散射法杖,就手套和腿部是紫色,冲到了boss门前,值得一提的是在boss门前的商店那里有一把免费的紫色法杖,可惜我犯贱放到存储箱里打算下局用[spoiler]妈蛋[/spoiler].
打开boss门,是一个圆形的大厅,四周都是倒刺墙和宝箱,被控制的妹子在最中间,不打她她不会动你,这时候可以去开一下旁边的宝箱,不过都打到最后一层了,宝箱里的武器其实已经没有多大作用了.
准备干boss,boss的血量相当的厚,至少250000,就算是锤子也得锤个几小时.所以就要用到墙上的钉子,我拿出我的绿色喷子法杖,由于我身上各种装备加成,导致我远程攻击的击退效果格外的强,不管距离墙有多远都能给顶过去,boss被顶到钉子上,直接掉将近70000的血,4下就没了,不到1分钟解决战斗.
boss战结束,控制妹子的人被吓跑,妹子也复原了晕倒在地上,还有一把紫色的钥匙.这时候需要扔掉所有的道具和装备(其实并不需要,装备栏是5*7,而妹子是4*7,所以可以留上最后一列),腾出装备栏,妹子会和装备一样在你的装备栏里.带着妹子,拿上钥匙,走到最后的大门那里,开门,游戏通关!

纠正一下,最后boss那里其实等弟弟说完话还是会打你的,所以,一圈的宝箱真的没什么用,就是通关之后开着爽一下吧! [spoiler]话说boss给个这么简单的真的好么[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198139007192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1518787631}
review:
A game with good potential. But still there are some problems in current stage.
1) The monsters are strengthened too much for each level. The problem is that no matter the rarity of your equipments, they will become meaningless when brought to the next level and you need to loot new weapons "fit" for the level. Or in other words, you will feel kinda "naked" when you enters a new level.
2) Still the difficulty. Below is how I deal with monsters in the game: i. try to grab attention of any single monster in a room ii. block-attack-block-attack..., repeat until it dies iii. repeat until all the monsters dies. It's so repetitive and totally a different game from the video. An unsuccessful block will cost you 20/120 health (or a health portion) on level 3, which is too costly to try anything cool. Wand is also not so useful since on level 3 it will basically cost ALL your mana to kill a single monster if you don't have a powerful wand.
3) The skill system is too RNG based. I once got three "ice mage" traits on leveling up while I dont have weapons dealing ice damage.
4) Death penalty. In non perma-death mode, you will be punished 25% attribute points on death, which makes you weaker each time. In my view, the current death punishment is actually not a big difference from perma-death cause I don't think I can achieve as much with less attribute points. I'd rather restart a new game.
To be fair, I may be biased cause I didn't spend much time or I may be poor on this game. I will give more tries and will edit or delete the comment if inappropriate. Experience sharing on the game is also welcomed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010263139', 'num_games_owned': 1445, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1518673132}
review:
Честно сказать, я не разделяю всеобщей радости насчет этой игры и подкину ложку дёгтя в бочку мёда. Выскажу свое имхо:
[h1]- передвижение и атака:[/h1] персонаж ходит, словно зацепился за гвоздик подтяжками. Удары оружием не ощущаются вовсе. ЛКМ вы будете ковырять мобов полдня, а пока "заряжается" ПКМ мобы наковыряют вас. А если подниметесь на второй уровень - то вообще пиши пропало. Враги там толще и жирнее в несколько раз, по сравнению с первым.
Блок номинальный: с медленным оружием вы попросту не будете успевать его ставить между атаками, да и большинство мобов успешно его пробивают. 
Если вы решили побегать с даггером/шотсвордом будьте готовы к промахам по мобам (привет, синие и желтые шарики) особенно "тычковой" заряженной атакой. Длина оружия совсем не ощущается, вроде бы должен попасть, а на самом деле не достал. 
Ванды стреляют весьма медленно, если моб идет к вам не по прямой траектории то попасть проблематично. 
"Толкайте мобов рюкзаком на шипы" говорили они. Ага, щаааас. Отталкивающая сила вкупе с кулдауном мешка делает это возможным только в том случае, если моб стоит прямо у самых шипов, иначе они банально успевают от них отойти и настучать вам по лицу.
[h1]- подземелье:[/h1] некоторые комнаты генерируются странно, нагромождаясь какими-то непонятно зачем поставленными лестницами, по которым персонаж движется, как калека, переходами, неразбиваемыми бочками и ящиками, валяющимися под ногами и мешающими отступать а также прочими предметами, через которые продираешься, как срочник на полосе препятствий.
Решетки, закрывающиеся за спиной отрежут вам путь к отступлению. Будьте готовы отъехать от пачки кротов, зажавших вас в углу.
[h1]- лут:[/h1] его величество рандом в деле - из первоначального сундука вы можете вытащить ваншотающую мобов палицу, а можете шотсворд с атакой 6-8, исход предсказуем.
С некоторых мобов сыпется, как из рога изобилия по 3-4 предмета, а в некоторых комнатах вы рискуете не получить ничего, кроме пары монет и БЧП.
Опять же, понятно, что рандом, но кольцо на скорость мили атаки, требующее интеллект - это нечто.
БЧП восполняют смехотворное количество ХП.
[h1]- прокачка:[/h1] и опять же рандом. Будьте готовы бегать с бесполезными скиллами, которые при этом еще и остаются после смерти. (какой-то странный roguelite, в играх такого типа ты сам выбираешь необходимые параметры при прокачке).Проще в этом случае начать новую игру.

Кроме вышеперечисленного, в игре отвратительная, на мой вкус, анимация, при довольно-таки своеобразной и приятной на вид графике. В целом, играть поначалу интересно, но постепенно начинают раздражать детали, описанные выше. 

Рекомендовать не могу, даже с оглядкой на ранний доступ

Если хотите поиграть в похожий dungeon crawler от первого лица, то попробуйте лучше Delver или Barony

author: {'steamid': '76561198070954960', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1626106660}
review:
You should try this out. 
Literally masterpiece. 
Thank you, Damian Schloter! Game industry needs people like you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393768051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1106, 'last_played': 1529013023}
review:
Slasher's Keep is a delight to play, with cell shaded graphics as a extra personal bonus on a sidenote. The game offers already very tight gameplay for a early acces title. Mechanics wise it has some flaws here and there but nothing game breaking, simply momentarily MAYBE interrupting. So far i made it to floor 4 and i shouldve make it a lot further with the way i play, but i lost focus for a moment and didn't use some of my 24 potions which i gathered trough the run.

I saw someone mentioning the gap of difficulty between floor 1 and then 2, and while this may be true, there are tons of ways to kill monsters. I found out the best way to do so is by running back a little and strike, run back a little and strike and so fort. There is the possibility to ofcourse do it in the way Damian Schloter wanted it to be, which is by precise blocking, but that took em longer and well....this feels fine as well. Traps can be used, together with the smart use of wands for luring monsters out of a room instead of jumping right in there and locking yourself. 

One annoying flaw on my end was the fact that you can get overrun by monsters and have nowhere to run lol, hence insta death is on the horizon after that. The music is fine plus voice acting for what is there, is actually great. Just keep on trying and find you way, and you will see its actually not that hard ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198013119250', 'num_games_owned': 2232, 'num_reviews': 469, 'playtime_forever': 3699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1606747466}
review:

[h1][b]Dawno nie bawiłem się tak dobrze w roguelite :)[/b][/h1]
Więcej - http://broda.tv / Społeczność growa - http://discord.broda.tv

Powodów jest sporo. Po pierwsze tzw. celshadingowa grafika - czyli komiksowa, wycinankowa, rysowana, z charakterystycznymi czarnymi krawędziami. W angielskich recenzjach czytałem, że to miks Darkest Dungeon (bez tur i na 1 osobę) oraz Dark Souls. Coś w tym jest - klimat rysowany mocno zachowany, a stopień trudności i sekunda na reakcje jak w Dark Souls też. Jednak kolejnym dużym atutem gry jest humor - gierka naśmiewa się z całej masy spraw związanych z gatunkiem roguelike albo dungeon crawler. Możemy przykładowo upolować karalucha w lochach i odnowić sobie kilka hp ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198444238726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1518462408}
review:
Атмосферная классическая RPG с оригинальной графической подачей. Самое важное - создает её всего один человек!
Здесь всё как мы любим: куча прикольного и, тем не менее, полезного лута; крафт; толпы разнообразных врагов; ловушки, секреты и лабиринты; попытка за попыткой в стремлении выбраться из подземелья.
Берите же скорее в руки окорок и приложитесь им со всей дури по зомбоморде!
Больше деталей в моем обзоре игры: https://youtu.be/_ced7gZuSAg

author: {'steamid': '76561198014651023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1602853427}
review: I like it, a lot. Needs a little more polish. Food doesn't help as far as I can tell. Could use a few more healing potions to drop. I've died alot. Lost count on how many times. Combat is cool, art is excellent! Love the equipment look on the paper doll. The enemies and dungeon are very cool looking. Fun to use the sack to knock enemies into spikes. Loot drops are pretty cool. Made it though the first floor, but my health was pretty much gone, so I died quick. Needs a rest feature or have the food you find give some health. Possibly restore hit points on leveling up. I think the designer is going for hard, and he has got it. Definitely worth it for me. Random starting equipment and levels are different each time. Did get one restart with a level that seemed to have nowhere to proceed after a couple of rooms, there might have been a secret door I missed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967070224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1518674161}
review: A very fun fps rogue like that leans more toward the classic turn based rogue than an action fps. The graphics are really great, it has tons of loot, stats, and perks. And can be played in both permadeath or checkpoint mode. I can see myself playing a round of this daily for a long time, as most of my permadeath runs have lasted about 45min. I love games that create a daily addiction, and with this I'm already hooked.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991615865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2212, 'last_played': 1606430845}
review:
Slasher's keep Is a roguelite Dungeon crawler with a cool combat system and great loot to be found. The game is in early access, and it shows. The great potential of the game is very clear already, however. In it's current state I can recommend it IF you can deal with the stuff I am going to mention now;

The game is difficult and buggy. This should be noted by all who would consider buying it. It's playable, its fun and its interesting. There's an ending and boss fight. It has everything a game would need to have. However, some bugs will lead to your death, save stations only save for when you quit the game, dying always sends you back to the first level with a huge penalty to your level (and thus your skills). On the other hand, some exploits allow you to farm items infinitely, grant you the posibility to get ludicrous stats and to craft a weapon even Zeus himself would be jealous of. 

Those exploits are what allowed me to beat the game. My character has over 500 in each of the 3 stats, my armor and weapons were blue or higher, with my weapon having 24 attachments with purple and blue parts too. I was one hitting every enemy with my ice wand, sniping everything from doorways. I could have gone into melee, but not only did my mana regen to 100% thanks to having a lvl 24 "coldblooded" skill, so i could spam wand shots forever. I also still got one hit by enemies. 

No I'm not kidding. At the 4 or 5th  level of the dungeon, enemies started one-hitting me, and they never stopped. No amount of armor would save me. Only through save-scumming (alt-f4 the game then reload a save if you die) did I get to the end. If I play a roguelike I expect to be screwed by bad stats or shitty items, but I also expect that epic loot will make the game easier. In Slasher's keep, you don't need good loot. You need cheesy loot. You need those 10 items with "Coldblooded" and that epic wand so you can snipe everything before it hits you. You need seperate items with "Artisan" and "Mastersmith" to be able to make an OP weapon that gives you 5 skills per attachment and allows you to attach 25 of those. 

I had all of that. And then the game decided it would generate a floor with geometry blocking off the only route to the exit. I tried everything to get past the inside of a boulder generated in a doorway. To no avail. I simply ran into a spike 3 times and got back to the first floor of the dungeon. I was level 20, not anymore though. I used to have epic gear, not anymore. I picked up my shitty weapon and armor and went on my way. The first enemy I found did 3000 damage to me. I had around 500HP. I reset again, losing even more levels. Now my guy is level 5. I got a couple floors in again, because I found a wand and have literally over 500 intelligence. Everything still one-hits me. But then again, I also kill everything in 2/3 hits and never have to get close. 

If after reading all this you still think giving the game a try is worth it, be my guest. I enjoyed the 14 odd hours I played of this game. I will probably play more, but I also eagerly await the much needed balance patch. 

PS.

Mr. Schloter, should you be reading this, your game is great. But by god is it not optimized correctly. 
- Enemy damage needs to scale better (as in not so high so quickly), or armor needs to do more, or both. 
- Some bugs need fixing, like the one randomly disabiling your block or attack. Or the one where you start running really fast for no reason, or the one where the room generation makes a secret door in a rock, so you cant run through said door, or the one where skills that are present on your weapon and armor don't actually show up on my character.
- Many skills need hard caps so you can't have "Bloodlust" so high it literally ticks your multi-kill time counter up instead of down every second.
- Sacrificing a (blue) potion to the altar should not give a (green) item with a chance to get a free potion. Because that (green) item then has a chance to give a potion when sacrificed, leading to infinite items and potions. The purple Stat-up potions should not be able to be sacrificed, as they can come from sacrificing green or higher potions randomly, but they give blue items when sacrificed, leading to free blue items very early and very easily. 
- Dying should have less of a penalty, maybe resetting you to a save point, but at the very least not taking (so many) levels from you as it does.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116303490', 'num_games_owned': 665, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1518289916}
review:
[h1]COMIC-STYLE![/h1]

Verrat!
Du findest dich beraubt deiner Habseligkeiten im Verlies von Slasher's Keep wieder. Viele haben versucht von hier zu entkommen und sie sind alle gescheitert...
Wirst du es ihnen gleichtun oder die Schrecken von Slasher's Keep überleben?

[h1]Die Technik[/h1]
Grafisch trifft Slasher's Keep mit seinem Comic-Cel-Shading-Look und handgezeichneten 2D-Sprites in einer 3D Umgebung genau meinen Nerv. :D
Performance is gut.
Sound ist gut.
Ich liebe den Song im Hauptmenü. ^^

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Spielerisch bietet Slasher's Keep alles, was man von einem Dungeoncrawler, wie Delver etc., erwartet. Schlagen, blocken, looten, erkunden, sterben und das Ganze wieder von vorne.
Dabei sammelt man natürlich auch Erfahrungspunkte die unweigerlich zum Level Up führen, der dir wiederum Skillpunkte beschert, die man in Stärke, Geschick oder Intelligenz investieren kann.

Der Dungeon wird dabei jedesmal random generiert.

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Slasher's Keep macht auch jetzt schon im Early Access einen guten Eindruck und man kann nur hoffen, dass das Ein-Mann-Entwicklerteam am Ball bleibt.
Spaß machts definitiv. :)

[h1]Von mir gibt es einen Early Access Daumen nach oben![/h1]

Wer einen ehrlichen Eindruck zu Gameplay, Atmosphäre und Sound gewinnen will, schaut einfach mal in mein Angezockt rein:

[b][url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5RhCMTIwVTQ]Angezockt: Slasher's Keep[/url][/b]

Ich wünsche - wie immer - viel Spaß beim Zocken! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198044506382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 1830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1195, 'last_played': 1627214103}
review:
3.3 更新： 逆风笑和王老菊都解说这款游戏了，我的人生圆满了

从前年开始就夜不能寐地关注着这款游戏的开发Twitter了，而现在终于释出了EA版！！（狂喜乱舞）

作为一款由单人开发的独立游戏，Slasher's Keep已远超我的期待：
[list]
 [*]画面 - Cel-Shading着色器与Billboard物件的结合，第一眼就给我留下了深刻印象。
此外，恰到好处的卡通美术风格，又给阴暗的地牢题材增添了一抹诙谐的色彩。

 [*]内容 - 在传统Roguelike式地牢探索玩法的基础上，着重强调了战斗部分：配合方向键与轻/重击，便能根据战术需求打出侧砍/前突/劈斩等不同的花招；而格挡时，玩家需将视角对准攻击袭来的方向，才可抵御住伤害。
若对战斗技巧没有自信，随处可见的尖刺/深坑陷阱也为执行地形杀提供了大量可能性（按F推搡怪物；地形杀有额外经验值）。
此外，武器拼装系统、交易所、秘密房间、祭坛等设定更是为游戏锦上添花；大量精心设计的随机要素与能继承装备的储存箱，在平衡了难度的同时也加强了重复可玩性。

玩家的最终目标是从关押自己的地下10F一路摸回地表 - 其间将逐渐出现新的怪物、装备、陷阱和地牢环境。
[/list]

由于本作尚处于早期测试，瑕疵也是有的 - 例如突然鬼畜的物体、偶尔闪烁的阴影贴图等。
但目前这类bug并没有影响我在地牢中大杀四方和搜刮宝藏 (`･ω･´) 先期待个后续的内容/修复补丁。

总而言之：推荐购买！
不说了，我还能再肝一趟

author: {'steamid': '76561198085084062', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1569303398}
review:
This game is fun to the core! I do however have some gripes with the game and how it's designed in some aspects.

1. The physics of the jump need a slight tweak and increased height just a tad, Overall its smooth and enjoyable but lacks some nessesities that i feel would make this game a better experience.

2. There will always be a time where you're stuck in a corner and your potate sac just doesn't do it, Doesn't feel deserved to die like this and feel simply... bad.

3. This point is a bit more personalized but i would love to see more new weapons in the game like Polearms and Bows, both of these can really freshen up the game and add more ways to play.

4. The option to disable posters around the dungeons. I was streaming this game the moment i got it and i had to look away instantly to avoid seeing some tiddums on stream and to hopefully not face a ban. Please consider working on this point in particular. If there is a way to turn it off let me know.

Overall i would give this game an 8.9 out of 10

+ Brilliant Gameplay

+ Unique art style

- Not many ways to play

- MASSIVE difficulty curve in stage 2

author: {'steamid': '76561198020899416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1518559247}
review:
I am a big fan of dungeon crawling and I have to say I am really enjoying this, the artstyle is fantastic and it is quite challenging (always play permadeath) it reminds me of the old wolfenstein but with more polish lol.

The random generation of dungeons and loot makes it interesting with every new start,  as you never know what you will come accross (this appears to be the case with the passive skills you are assigned after levels up's and through gear).

The combat actually feels responsive..its great when you one shot a zombie or goblin and the blocking appears to be on point.

You have quite a few breakables which help including the vases and the boxes with the health potion symbol on, these tend to drop money, food and potions to help replenish health / mana or to become invulnerable for several seconds.

I have only got to level 2 (almost to level 3) and noticed how much harder and how much more HP the mobs have, so make sure you get a few level ups on the first level before you go on ahead further lol.

You also have alternative rooms for example a shrine you can offer gear to for a reward or curse, you also have shops, health/mana globes and a mounted lion head which offer you quests i.e. kill 2 creates with an explosion x2 (look for barrels with fire symbol on - require one hit to set off, just make sure your not trapped in one corner before you do :P)

To note, when you enter the fairly big rooms the door tends to slam shut behind you until you have killed every creature in the room, so be aware!.

I have also come accross 'components' some very powerful which basically add to your weapon as an enhancment, I have yet to apply one however, if your lucky enough I think there are forges's that allow you to apply them to your weapon that can appear on levels - on this ..you sometimes get map drops which will show you important symbols on the map, i.e. secret doors, keys etc.

I have only come accross one bug that appears to be after I have used a wand, i am unable to melee or block until i remove the weapon and add it back on through the inventory, sometimes the mobs will walk into boxes and shelves which impede their movement but you can use this to your advantage, smacking the mobs off into the abyss or onto a spike trap is satisfying.

I am looking forward to spending more time in the game, obviously it still needs work i.e. more enemy variety, more loot, boss fights, more rooms, classes etc but this is a thumbs up for me!..I am looking forward to seeing what more this gem has to offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984712587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1518491033}
review:
[h1]TL:DR;[/h1]
If you're into dungeon crawlers, this should feel familiar.  Level up, collect items, become powerful, kill everything.  Sound is great and the art style I particularly enjoy.  The game takes a dull and drab environment and transforms it into eye candy while still keeping the gameplay we enjoy so much.  Did not encounter any bugs.  Even early in development, I can recommend.

[h1]First Impression Gameplay[/h1]
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iQ5mHYfHzgE&feature=youtu.be

[h1]Full Review[/h1]
Slasher's Keep is a fun dungeon crawler with cartoony graphics and a light-hearted atmosphere.  You start out "locked" in a prison cell, with your only option to fight your way out.  The prison cell room is the same every play through, but each subsequent game features a new dungeon layout (procedurally generated).    The goal of the game is to escape the dungeon by crawling up throughout each level of the keep.

Weapons are varied in the game; clubs, maces, magic wands, swords, etc.  Dead enemies can drop various pieces of gear, either weapons, armor, potions, or money.  If you've played a dungeon crawler before, than you get the idea.

Controls are decent, and I only have minor complaints.  Attacks feel okay, but I wish they carried some more impact.  You can block as well, but only if your main attack animation is completed.  One thing I thought was particularly clever is the ability to use your inventory bag to hit enemies with.  

Sound is excellent, from the ambient noises to the soundtrack to enemy grunt noises.  The music at the title screen is particularly good.

Graphics are a bit of a highlight for me.  I really enjoy the direction they took with this.  Instead of gray and dull as most dungeon crawlers are, this game finds a away to make things still look great.  The game is a little silly, and you see that from the artwork on posters in game and from various things throughout.

Even as early as it is in this games development, this feels like a full game.  I recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091250170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1602112063}
review: I've been waiting for this game to come out for over a year now, so when  I saw that it had been released, I bought it immediately. The game is hack n' slash and it's very unique from what I've seen so far. The art style is something you don't see often, and minor details here and there are nice to pick up on. Maybe I just suck at the game, but it's actually somewhat challenging, which keeps you motivated to play to beat the floors. You actually have to use some survival strategies to avoid dying, rather than chug potions all day in other rpg like games. There are glitches here and there, but the game overall is very impressive in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045458165', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1606235282}
review:
Скажу сразу! Если вы желаете поддержать разработчика, то берите, если хотя бы немного сомневаетесь - повремените с покупкой.
На момент написания отзыва игра сырая и требует многих доработок и контента, однако и на данном этапе зависнуть в ней можно. Что же это за творение? По сути, это обычный рогалик, в котором нам нужно выбраться из подземелья, однако боёвка в игре сделана в духе скайрима, а графика - в очень сочном и красочном 2D. От чего выглядит свежо и играется приятно. 
Из плюсов выделю:
+ оригинальное исполнение
+ МНОГО лута
+ МНОГО слотов, куда лут пихать
+ обычный рогалик
Из спорных моментов хотелось бы выделить боёвку, так как лично мне очень не нравится, что здесь нельзя как-то отпрыгивать, уклоняться, а можно только бить и ставить блок, отчего в лицо ты будешь получать всегда. А хилки тут удовольствие редкое. Было бы круто добавить больше подвижности хотя бы для лёгкого оружия, и уж тогда полное поглощение урона в блоке для тяжёлого оружия. 
Минусы:
- чувствуется сырость игры 
- оптимизация пока хромает
- нехилая сложность (на первом этаже можно набить уровня 2-3, а для второго требуется минимум десятый, но благо вроде как характеристики персонажа после смерти сохраняются, отчего это даже можно убрать из минусов)
- из-за 2D порой не понятно, достанет атака до противника или нет
В общем-то и всё. Минусы в основном из-за раннего доступа и непривычности к механике.
Подытоживая, повторю, что покупайте только если понравилась идея и желаете поддержать разработчика. Если сомневаетесь - подождите

author: {'steamid': '76561197998981860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1721, 'last_played': 1607065252}
review:
Original review:

I have been monitoring this game for a few months as I nervously waited for it's steam release. I was overjoyed today when I saw it had released this morning. After starting  it up and quickly choosing a randomized character, I found myself locked in a cell with the keys being visible through a crack in the wall. After attempting to retrieve the keys for a minute, I accidentally stumbled upon the solution to the puzzle. While I wouldn't spoil it here, it was unexpecteed and hilarious and really sets the tone for the rest of the game. As I emerged from my cell, a nearby chest rewarded me with a bunch of bananas on a stick/mace and a wizard hat. Slasher's Keep is a lighthearted, hand drawn dungeon crawler with peppy, skyrimy hack and slash combat and fun physics. It is clear that Damian Schloter loves his game and put a lot of heart into this project.

Update:

After putting 10 hours into this game I would stay it still holds up. There are some minor issues, the biggest being difficulty scaling in general, but the one big technical glitch was fixed by a patch on the first day. There are no issues that ruin the game right now in my opinion. I am sure this game will get much better as Damian continues to update and balance it. Even as it is now, If you like the idea and are willing to deal with minor early access issues as the game grows and improves, you will likely enjoy this game. I wholeheartedly reccomend it.
